Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hall and face, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Corrado_C
Reviews.Content: I am in Rome quite often and I had seen this hotel with this elegant and great facade, but the experience has not been so nice, the room was not so large and with an uncomfortable bathroom not in line with a luxury hotel level However the hall and breakfast were very good

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff, in a great location in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sue M
Reviews.Content: A gorgeous hotel in a great location in the centre of Rome. Our room was very comfortable and quiet, just a shame there was no coffee making facility. All the staff were by far the most friendly, helpful and welcoming we've experienced on our travels worldwide. We visited the spa (included in the price of our trip) twice a day, which was a great boost after all that sight seeing and walking! Overall a fantastic place, which we'd love to stay in again!

Reviews.Title: “upscale boutique hotel - worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: patricesantiago
Reviews.Content: Nice boutique hotel with character, even if you are not a big fan of rococo style, you will enjoy the luxurious but not too pretentious environment. Service is very good, in particular at front desk. Rooms are comfy, well equipped and quiet for those with a view on the courtyard. Wifi works well and quick. Ask for pre paid cheaper voucher for breakfast or go to cafe de paris on via veneto at 5 minute walk. Metro station is close, and taxi on call reach the hotel usually in 5 minutes. Hotel has spa and swimming pool. Staff attentive and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MIchaelAngeloB
Reviews.Content: I love the hotel! The room was very eye appealing, not to mention the assortment of different lotions, shampoos, and conditioners they had by the glass sink. Wifi was free but the spa wasn't. But the best part about everything was the staff! They were very friendly and extremely helpful. All their recommendations from tailors to tours to restaurants was on point! Only bad thing is anything extra is costly ie. the laundry service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thierry D
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly and professional always trying to accommodate. Our room with nice and quiet and the restaurant is very good, we had dinner twice. The WIFI should be free in that hotel category. We live in Miami but we will come back as soon as possible..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but all extras are expensive”
Reviews.Author: Rockersyster
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, impeccable service and cool design There´s every service you can imagine avaliable, at a cost of course. No free WiFi and breakfast is not included. However the spa is free of charge and you can wrap yourself in the thick white robes and relax for hours if you desire.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for Roma”
Reviews.Author: chayato
Reviews.Content: 10mn walking from the Spanish Steps, the hotel is very well located and offers decent features. The hotel lacks natural light however the service is excellent and offers overall high standards. The rooms are big and comfortable. Great breakfast, however room service is overpriced: I was charged 26€ for a simple tomato & mozzarella salad...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very nice lobby but the rooms are a bit dated.”
Reviews.Author: Hillbillycat
Reviews.Content: The entrance and the lobby are very nice but the floors are not the same standard and the rooms are in need of refurbishing (even though you can see they were once very modern). The service is good by South-European standards (my only complaint is that if you need an iron you need to come down to reception to sign a indemnity letter which is at least a first time for me). If you are a business travel and had your (more than) fair share of hotel breakfasts I would recommend taking a left when coming out of the hotel and have a great morning espresso and sandwich at the small coffee shop on the opposite side of the streetl. The location is good and walking distance to Piazza Navona, the Pantheon and shopping. I would probably expect a bit more for what they are normally charging but when I stayed there we had a good corporate discount. P.S This hotel offers promotions to guest that give them positive feedback on Tripadvisor but this review is not in any way biased by this. D.S.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: MeriamTanGravador
Reviews.Content: My experience with the hotel I would say is just okay as first the hotel was booked by the office of my husband and they shouldered all the expenses during our stay in Rome but in case we are the ones paying for the accommodation then i guess we will have some issues with this hotel. first, there were no free internet connection in our room, no wifi. internet is only available at the lobby area and the connection is very slow. the location is in a slope area and we have to walk to get to our tour bus as this is situated in a tight space and there were no parking area. there were no near cafes and convenience store nearby and the alleys along the street is not that well lighted so you feel not that safe but to be fair the hotel has a nice toiletries a variety of choices and is quiet so you will have a good sleep. all in all i think this is just an okay hotel but considering it is a 5-star hotel then it did not met the high standards expected of its kind. PS the heater in the room seems to be not working as we cannot determined the diff between the 1 to 3 thermostat.(we visited during winter time)

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room & tried to swindle us over extras”
Reviews.Author: Catherine d
Reviews.Content: We paid an upgrade for our 5* room to superior standard. What a waste of money. The room was so small you could just about walk around the bed and it felt claustrophobic. The large window was overlooked by rooms only a few meters away with one heavy blind. It meant we had to chose between privacy or sunlight. The shower was actually a bath with a broken sliding door and the overhead shower piece gave a very light splattering of water. Everything was extra on top of the expensive room cost including 20 Euro per person for a very mediocre breakfast in a dark windowless dining area, nothing to compare with other 5* hotels that we have stayed in. To top it all off they gave us our final bill in Italian and had charged the pair of us for breakfast for four people. I find it hard to believe this was a mistake as we purchased the breakfast through a voucher system at the reception desk. They must rely on a % of tourists not checking or understanding the Italian bill. The bedding was insufficient for the cold snap but we had to ask several times for extra bedding as our initial requests did not produce results; the bed itself was rock hard and the sheets were rough. Avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Cool yet warm”
Reviews.Author: thughes59
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tucked away up a side street directly off Via Veneto. Staff friendly & efficient and are dressed a bit like space cadets, in line with the chic modern feel of this hotel. Airline misplaced my suitcase, hotel took over enquiries and it was delivered to my room the following day. The spa pool in the basement is beautifully done if a little compact and bijou. The steam room and sauna are also more claustraphobic than you'd normally expect. The cosmopolitan bar area on the ground floor is perfect for people watching - watched an American tourist drink so much she fell off her seat; they politely carried her out like a sack of old laundry, hilarious!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic One i don't know why all before wrote negative things”
Reviews.Author: wael E
Reviews.Content: arriving to the hotel finding the door man with nice smile offering us a help with a lot of bags that me and my wife always carrying ( women shopping ) enter the hall and find 2 Samurai on front of us very nice thing that you can never imagine in Rome anyway we made the check in .. the guys there really fantastic they accompany us to the rooms and explain to us about the hotel comparing that i travel a lot i found very good hotel all the staff are really fantastic and helpful from the doorman and the bellboy and the reception and the whole staff from the restaurant especially we came in busy period but we really always found the attention and the helpful. for the rooms Super Super clean with a good space inside the rooms by the way it was standard room but really big comparing that other hotel i stayed at the city center .. something else they are near every thing 5 minutes spanish steps and 5 minutes to Trevi fountain .. really i enjoyed there and i will be back in the future

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing time!”
Reviews.Author: ingenico5100
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this amazing hotel just before Christmas for my three nights in Rome. The hotel is in the heart of the city, a perfect location for shopping and eating out. I had an absolutely wonderful time. The staff are very polite, and the concierge was particularly helpful. I spent several hours at the SPA taking advantage of the steam room, sauna, roman pool, plus I had a great relaxing massage. I will be back during the summer time, and for sure I will stay more days and enjoy the roof garden atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING boutique hotel - location, pampering, beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Michal4444
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a Romantic long weekend at the Boscolo Aleph hotel in January 2012 and it was truly one of the best boutique hotels we've ever stayed at. The hotel is absolutely beautiful - every inch of it is designed meticulously, you can tell that so much thought went into the planning of every corner and niche. Our room was very comfortable and lovely to come back to after every excursion in the city - one of the room's highlights is the lavish set of over 20 soaps and lotions set-up smartly in numbered long tubes that you can pick and choose from with the help of a "soap menu" that explains what each soap/lotion is. It was just a small detail of the room, but one that made us feel pampered and taken care of. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful beyond words - all of the concierge staff were extremely helpful in recommending tourist attratctions and making reservations for us, and always with a smile. Lastly (but no less important): the hotel's location is fantastic - we walked EVERYWHERE throughout the entire city. It's about a 2 minute walk to Barberini Square (where the metro is, if/when needed), a 7 min. walk to the Spanish steps, and everything else is walking distance as well with varying times. Side note: this hotel is very very similar to the exquisite "Soho Hotel" in London, where we stayed 3 years ago for double the cost. In short, this hotel is a real find. Enjoy! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Exceedingly Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: christian c
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a few days in December of 2011. True, the lobby has an alternative and attractive decor, but that is all this hotel offers. The room was small and the bed extremely uncomfortable. The only restaurant and bar operating during our stay were located on the first floor adjacent to the lobby. Well, during our stay they had three separate events for private parties. We were told that because of the private events we could not eat at the restaurant, drink at the bar or even sit in the lounge area of the lobby. Really? We are staying at what purports to be a five star hotel and we can't even drink or eat there because they rented the entire public space to private holiday parties? In essence, we were told we could walk through the lobby to get to the elevator and go up to our room. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Gilda01
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last April and loved it, the service is outstanding. Close to all the main attractions, the rooms are spacious and clean. I enjoyed the spa after a long walk to the Trevi Fountain, and cocktails at Il Palazzeto by the Spanish Steps. Area is safe for walking, I got good restaurant information from the concierge Enzo D'Amico. If you need further information do not hesitate to ask questions. Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Purrrfect for couples”
Reviews.Author: sbahety
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend and loved it. Tried out breakfast one morning, and it was ok. We preferred going down the road to a small cafe to enjoy some sun. Everything about the hotel was great, absolutely nothing to complain. Loved the test tube soaps etc. in the bathroom. Location is super convenient to walk up to the Spanish stairs, or take the subway to wherever you want to go. There are also a lot of cool shops down Via Sistina as are numerous little cafes, should you need a quick shot with some dolci.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel and awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jbook13
Reviews.Content: My wife and i just returned from our honeymoon which included a two-night stay at Boscolo Aleph. I was very worried about this hotel because of all the negative reviews, but it turned out to be a great experience. Champagne was waiting for us in the room and rose petals adorned our bed the second evening, both a nice touch. All of the staff was extremely friendly, knowledgeable about Rome and they gave us two great restaurant recommendations which really enhanced our Rome experience. The rooms were very clean and we loved the windows which opened fully to allow the cool air and the sounds of the city to come in. I was slightly disappointed that the terrace bar was closed this time of year, and more disappointed that the pool was not operational (for reasons not clarified) because the pool room is really beautiful. I'd also skip the breakfast buffet and find a bite elsewhere for much less. However, we weren't in Rome to lounge poolside and there are plenty of bars to enjoy, so these things didn't ruin our experience. I'm not sure what went wrong earlier in the year, but the website has been redesigned and things look to have turned the corner for this property.

Reviews.Title: “I Don't Understand These Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Jro_11
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. The staff were so nice (and the all spoke english very well). I arranged for a spa treatment (which is in the basement of the hotel) and they arranged it for me no problem. The hotel is stylish and very clean. I am not sure this is a 5 star hotel, but it is certainly acceptable. It is also very close to everything. In fact, one day we hired a guide (to show us the sites in Rome), the hotel made all the arrangements and the guide was very charming. She showed us everything and then some. I would highly recommend this hotel. Again, I don't get some of these reviews....this place was very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Very average for a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: YaelNewCity
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Rome and staff were very professional and allowed us early check in. I found the hotel lobby area very accommodating but small. The decor was a mix of contemporary and old world and was supposed to signify an entrance into hell. Heaven was below at the spa. Very strange! When the bellman brought our bags to the room he did not show us or explain anything about the room or hotel. His service was less than adequate. The room was average both in size and decor. Lighting was minimal. We faced the back, had no view and it was dark. There was enough drawer space and the closets size was adequate but the rods were so high that it was difficult to hang up clothes. Who would think in an expensive hotel they would have the security type hangers and then position them so high that it was difficult to insert the body into the holder? The bathroom was roomy, very modern and beautiful. Very nice. There was no wireless in hotel rooms and available for $20+ per day in the lobby. I complained and they allowed me the use of the wireless. I had been led to believe that the whole hotel was wireless. The breakfast buffet at 30 Euros per person was limited and repetitive. No concierge and limited information on restaurants or activities in area. Definitely would never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would NEVER stay there again!!! Not to be recommended!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wafky
Reviews.Content: Having been in Florence for a wedding my wife and I decided to visit Rome for a few days in May/June 2011. whilst the city was incredible, the same cannot be said about this supposed 5* hotel. The staff were very pleasant on arrival but took a long time to locate my booking. When we eventually got to our room I walked in to find the curtain hanging off the rail, the bathroom door hanging off and the air con sounded like it was ready to explode, not to mention the musky smell. I called reception to complain and Gemma arranged for us to move rooms. To my amazement, when I walked in to my second room the first thing i noticed was that the curtain was again falling off the rail, the shower door was again loose, there were used toiletries in the shower which also had dirty tiles. It also only worked as a trickle, not powerful enough to clean my shoes, let alone shower in. When called reception again I noticed a huge amount of dead bugs within the main lampshade. I called Gemma again who upgraded us to a suite. We checked in to our suite and was once again appauled to find another curtain hanging loose off the rail. The walls were stained near the bathroom and there was also a stain on the floor on the entry to the bathroom. Once I entered the bathroom I looked into the bath, only to find a huge mark in the bath from where it had previously been repaired. I was also upset to notice that the chair arm was broken. There was also a rip in the pillow case. I telephoned Gemma at reception to tell her of this and she said that she would speak to the manager and get back to me. We never heard back from her. We had had such a long day travelling that we could not cope with switching rooms for a 3rd time (as my wife is pregnant) so we simply decided to stay in the room. On our second night we returned from dinner early and decided to watch a movie. I tried to use the ‘pay tv’ service but it did not work. I phoned reception and they told me that the engineer had gone home and would fix it tomorrow. When I returned the next evening I asked at reception if anybody had repaired our television and I was informed that the engineer had done all the jobs he had been asked to complete so my tv should now work. Once again I tried to use the pay tv service only to find it was still not working. I called reception and was told again that the engineer had gone home but somebody would call me back. 10 minutes later I received a phone call advising me that nobody in the hotel had pay tv, however, this had still ruined our second evening. I have to admit that this is not the standard I expect from a 5 star hotel, in fact, I have stayed in 3 star hotels with better standards. I had very much looked forward to my visit to Rome and the Boscolo Aleph, but I left very very disappointed with the hotel and feel that the claims to be a 5 star hotel were nothing misleading lies. I emailed the hotel on 15th June 2011 to complain about all of these but heard nothing back. I called about the lack of reply to my email and was told that someone would reply. It's now October and still no reply. I am left no other option than to document our experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: DLH_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were recent guests and found our stay to be most enjoyable. The staff, in particular Jaime and Gem, were very professional and helpful. Because of Hurricane Irene our return flight was canceled and Gem went out of her way to assist us with phone calls, the internet, etc. Our room/bathroom were impeccably clean (I loved the many different gels and toiletries provided). The air conditioning worked wonderfully and was most welcome, as almost every day of our stay in Rome reached 100 degrees. Beautiful outdoor terrace/bar on the top floor. The location of Aleph Boscolo is ideal as well, and on a quiet,cobblestone road. I would return again and highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The best experience ever in Italy.”
Reviews.Author: SamiHurme
Reviews.Content: I can truly recommend the Aleph Boscolo Hotel Rome. The hotel was a really positive experience. The room was spacious which is not typical for Italian hotel. Breakfast was very extensive, and the terrace bar on the roof was very pleasant. The location is good, because the noise of the city does not carry up to the hotel. Certainly not to the top floor, where our room was located. Nearby Villa Borghese park is suitable for fine morning run. Aleph Boscolo's staff was one of the service-minded, which I've never come across on my trips. Maybe even the best team ever in any European hotel. The room was cleaned and towels and robes were changed twice a day, while the spa products were complemented in bathroom. Late late check out was a complete success and the doorman organized a comfortable ride to the airport. I will certainly head to this hotel next time in Rome. And if you had enough Italian food the Hard Rock Cafe Rome is one block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We thought it was great, and the staff were lovely”
Reviews.Author: DellsBells
Reviews.Content: Took my elderly mother & 17 year old daughter on a 4 day to Rome. Booked with expedia and was worried about the reviews, but we had a good deal. We had two rooms next to each other and they were newly refurbished and spotless, we were privided with robes & slippers, really comfy Kingsize bed with good quality bedding & air conditioning. The staff were extremly helpful. The location was good. The negatives - breakfast wasn't included in our price and was 25 euros a head per day, there weren't any coffee/tea in the room but there was a mini bar. And there isn't a restaurant on site. Only Italian tv, but we were only there to sleep. We were told about the roman baths prior to arrival, so new in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Deeply disappointed - This is a 3*hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenfrenis
Reviews.Content: I did read all of the reviews on this hotel, however i decided to book as my friend had stayed. it was not until we were there I text her to ask when exactly she had stayed here and she said in 2005!! The reviews on this website are correct.......I was so disappointed with the hotel - it is definately a 3 star. We had to move rooms 3 times, the first was tiny and dark, the second not much better and the third we settled with as the room was very big and the hotel said they could not upgrade us as the hotel was fully booked over the weekend. The entrance to the hotel is very impressive, however, the interior is extremely dated - i think it was refurbished in 2003 which would explain why my friend enjoyed it in 2005! The hotel knew i was extremely disappointed, and after moving our room also brought us nibbles and some fizzy wine which was nice. However, later on i wanted to check that the roman baths were working..OH DEAR. the downstairs smelt of sewerage and i asked staff how long the roman baths had been out of service.They advised that they hadnt been working for 6 months as there was a problem with the pump! In addition, the roof top bar had parties on every night........ Again, i had to speak to staff and they gave us a free breakfast every morning. To conclude, the service of staff isnt the issue, it is the overall quality of the hotel and the amenties that you would expect for a 5 star hotel. It is definately a 3 star! I do not usually write reviews on the hotels that we stay at, however, it is important that anyone considering staying here is fully aware of what to expect!

Reviews.Title: “Glad I ignored the bad reviews...”
Reviews.Author: superham
Reviews.Content: You just never know do you? I checked into Roma Boutique because of all of the great reviews but had the worst sleep of my life at a hotel. I had to check out after 1 night and we headed over to Boscolo Aleph due to the proximity. It's a mid size hotel and more on the trendy side. I think people need to just accept the fact that 5 star is not the same in Europe as it is in the U.S. 5 star to us is like a St. Regis or Ritz Carlton but over there, it simply implies "pretty decent hotel"! With that said, we were very pleased with our room. The bed was comfortable, it was spacious enough, the bathroom was a good size. I like how they give you tubes of body wash, shampoo, conditioner and mouth wash to choose from. You get slippers and robes, dressers, and closet space. The only "bad" thing was the small tube TV. I was suprised they didn't have flat screens but honestly we never used the TV so it didn't matter. Another issue was was the internet. They said it is $10 Euro for 30 minutes of wifi. Um no thanks!! Also the breakfast buffet was $20 Euro. We showed up at 10 am. There were no eggs and barely any potatoes, sausage and bacon left. They only replenished the eggs. It was by far the most disgustings eggs I have ever tasted. The meat was cold so that tasted bad, too. This is seriously the worst breakfast I have ever had at any hotel! Moving on, the concierge is pretty helpful. I think it was Gemma that recommended a few good restaurants. When we checked out, the hotel ended up refunding breakfast and wanted to offer us a free one, which is good customer service on their part. I really love the location of this hotel. It is down the street from Via Veneto and the the taxi stand is literally a block or so away at Barberini. Overall, a very pleasant stay and location.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in city center”
Reviews.Author: He_michelle
Reviews.Content: We booked a weekend stay at this hotel on lastminute.com as an anonymous purchase without knowing any details beforehand. Our experience far exceeded our expectation. From its artistic decor to the very helpful staff and central location, the hotel impressed us as a hidden gem in central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: ClaireLoisAnna
Reviews.Content: There is nothing "luxury", "boutique" or 5 star (not even 4 star) about this place. When my husband and i arrived to check in, the man on the desk proceeded to answer a phone call and left us standing there while we were ignored. Once they were ready to deal with us, there was no "welcome" comment, merely "passports" was barked at us and a room key given to us. We were left to our own devices to get the luggage to our room, and as soon as i stepped out of the elevator, i know i would be disappointed with the room. The lobby area is quite trendy/modern, and the lift has nice black and white pictures, but the corridors on our level (1) had a nasty blue carpet, no decoration and random housekeeping items left hanging around - a vaccum cleaner here, some bed linen there. Our room was very 90s with nasty fake wood panelling. I wouldn't have minded so much about the decor as i appreciate some things are subjective, but there were many things broken - TV didn't work, air con made a loud noise, (so much so we had to turn it off to sleep), no bottled water, no iron, tiles missing on the bathroom floor, broken table in the bathroom. After paying a HUGE sum for two nights stay, it just seemed a bit insulting. (And breakfast wasn't included in our outrageously expensive rate). The problems with our room wouldn't have been so bad if service had been good - but it wasn't. We asked the reception to make a dinner reservation for us, which they never managed to do. Even after reminding them THREE times to call, they never managed to call the restaurant so we ended up ringing ourselves. We didn't eat at the hotel, so i can't comment on the food. We went up to the roof bar but there was a private party on and so i cannot comment on that either. All in all, this place is a bit confused. On one hand you have a building in a great area, with an impressive looking lobby/bar, but rooms that are dated and need a refurb. Staff could do with a bit more customer relations training. On the positive side, we were out and about all day sightseeing so we were rarely in the hotel. And the hotel is conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “'Extreme 5 Star Luxury' - 10 YEARS AGO!!!”
Reviews.Author: KLB82
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel via Last Minute as part of their Top Secret deals I was extremely excited about staying in 'Extreme 5 Star Luxury'. After booking I read some of the reviews on here and felt slightly apprehensive, and I'm sad to report that they are pretty accurate. I'm sure when this hotel opened in 2003 it was the epitome of design cool and luxury, but unfortunately you can tell that it opened in 2003 and that it's edge has worn off (literally) and hasn't been refreshed. The room we booked was small, smelt damp, tatty (damaged blinds, scratched walls, shower door hanging off) and the shower 'half worked'. On day 2 the toilet broke and wouldn't flush so we were moved rooms. While it was better, it still felt old with dirty walls, cracked cupboards and worn carpet. The pool still wasn't working (which according to here has been for the last few months or so) and the 'gym' consisted of one cycling machine and some weight machines. Customer service was pretty non-existent with no-one answering the phones on reception until you'd rung several times. It took 2 hours for someone to respond when we complained our toilet wasn't working and our request for an iron never even materialised despite asking twice. Yes the reception looks 5 star, the prices are 5 star and the location is great, but overall this hotel is currently pushing 3 star at best. They clearly are refurbing as there was a lot of painting etc going on while we were there but there is a long way to go to '5 star'. Definately not worth a deal let alone full price, with hindsight I wish we'd booked a 3 or 4 star as it would have been a much better experience. If you're looking for 5 star luxury unfortunately this hotel is currently not it.

Reviews.Title: “Why would a hip, cool looking hotel have almost no access to technology?”
Reviews.Author: lmkNy_ny
Reviews.Content: Loved the look of the hotel but when I tried to get onto the internet they wanted 20 euros a day! And there was not even WIFI in the lobby! The television was old, and only had 12 channels- remember those days? The design of the room was nice but the bathroom tiles looked either like black mildew or dark grout replacing broken tiles- either way that was a bit nasty. I asked for a box of tissues for three days and never got it. Also asked for an iron which took two days as they said the hotel only has 2 irons. Then, to top it off, they made me sign a disclaimer that I would be held responsible for any damaged caused by my ironing! Clearly all the things we mentioned to the front desk, they had heard before. This hotel is poorly managed but has nice bones.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms would visit again”
Reviews.Author: Cactustoaster
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the previous reviews and choosing to stay on lastminute top secret hotels I was pleased and relieved to find pretty good rooms, clean and good bathroom and shower and a comfortable hotel to stay in a great area of town. The reception and the public areas including the bar were ok but a bit pretentious. Staff were ok but not overly friendly. We didnt use the hotel for breakfast as there was some really good places around Barberini much cheaper. We picked up the open top coach for a trip around Rome at Barberini Square and Harry's bar for a drink. Although it felt dodgy we took one of the trips from the touts outside the colloseum and handing over money in the street, 15 euros each felt a bit odd and we had a great trip around which included a trip to the forum it is really good as you dodge the lines and it doesnt really cost much more. Roman bath at the hotel didnt work and the hotel hadn't let on when we booked. I would stay again though.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of potential, but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LiliaNYC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel twice, for 4 nights each time. The first time was in 2009, and the second a couple of weeks ago, in March 2011. I had truly LOVED this place the first time. I loved the crazy modern red décor in the lobby, the classic Italian film stills lining the elevators, the gorgeous rooftop bar, and above all the overall original outlandish design for every detail - as my husband described it: “If Cavalli and Versace had a pissing contest, this would be the result”. I really liked our room, which was spacious, with extremely high ceilings and a lovely settee at the bed’s feet; we had been given one of the only 3 or 4 rooms with a huge terrace, with a wooden table, stylish outdoor canvas chairs, and loungers - we really enjoyed our evening aperitifs and morning breakfast out there. However, what really made a difference compared to other hotels was the spa – after a long day of sightseeing, there is nothing more regenerating than chilling out in their tranquil, serene, elegant turquoise Roman bath. That was the main reason we decided to go back to that hotel for our second visit to Rome. Well, were we ever disappointed! It turns out that the Roman bath is now closed, and they can’t even say when it will reopen (some issue with some pump spare part they can’t locate). So, the spa was virtually useless. They do have a sauna and steam bath, but those are pretty standard, similar to those you find in any gym - not even worth the time. Even though we paid for a deluxe room, the balcony rooms were not available. The room we got was nice and spacious, but not especially well decorated – rather on the plain side. There was nothing particularly original, elegant or stylish about it. The rooftop bar, which boasts a gorgeous view over Rome roofs, was closed because it was still considered “winter”, even though the temperature was in the 70s. All in all, given the current status and wide selection of hotels that exist, this hotel is good, but definitely not worth the money they charge - unless you get one of the few balcony rooms, and definitely until they fix their Roman Bath spa.

Reviews.Title: “The Aleph is not five star and the breakfast awful”
Reviews.Author: magicgs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aleph for four nights room and breakfast. We have stayed at a number of five star hotels and this is not one (I would say four star) however we do have positive comments . The hotel is comfortable and styling eccentric contemporary.The room was fine, clean and we did sleep well as it was quiet which is a must for me so that was great. The Hotel was in an excellent location close to the Metro, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. The door staff were always pleasant. The breakfast and breakfast staff were disappointing and this is what let the hotel down for us. There is not much choice for breakfast and the staff slow. I sat for fifteen minutes before being offered any tea or coffee when it was not even busy and watched a member of staff clean the table next to me avoiding any eye contact. The girl who ticks off the room numbers looked sullen and her attitude left a lot to be desired, I love tomatoes with my breakfast and everyday they looked green and disgusting. The first two days we got freshly squeezed orange juice which was nice and the next two orange from concentrate. Nothing looked desirable to eat so I decided to do what the italians do and have coffee and pastries. I couldn't believe it when the pastries were not even fresh tasting. The hotel food menu is very expensive so because the breakfast and service was so bad we didn't even consider eating in the hotel. Watch out for being ripped off by cafe/bar owners. Always ask how much for everything before you sit down and if you do sit down you may be charged for that too. The wine is more expensive than at home in fact all food and drink is more expensive. The metro is good and cheap for getting around if you have tired feet. Rome was great to see just bring plenty of money for your food and drink and wear comfortable shoes (I never even wore my heels once)

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in good location with friendly staff and very comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Journey2011
Reviews.Content: I had a great long weekend at this hotel. I have been to Italy many times and have always struggled to find a hotel that befits its rating and prices. So far, this is the best hotel I have stayed at in Rome considering those factors. The location is very good for both business (conference room available) and leisure as it's within walking distance of many tourist sites such as the Spanish Steps and the Trevi fountain, but is also near offices. The room was very comfortable and the bed was fantastic (I even asked the front desk to give me the make of the bed because I want to buy one!). The bathroom was well- fitted and I loved the test tube toiletries. The hotel decor is trendy (a bit quirky) and modern with a throw back to the fifties with some interesting photographs (my favourite being the picture of Sofia Loren in the lift). The staff were generally friendly and helpful, particularly the lady on the front desk and the door man. I plan to stay here again and will be checking out other Boscolo hotels in Italy. I didn't manage to check out the spa but will do on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Such welcoming and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: WCPM
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay in this hotel. Quite central, walking distance to most attractions but what stood out the most were the lovely helpful, cheerful staff. Nothing was too much trouble. They sorted out our driver to pick us up in a beautiful Mercedes at a reasonable cost, on arrival at the Hotel they gave us help in and around Rome with reservations for restaurants. We had a really good chat to the barman who was eager and interested in where we were from and whether we were having a good time. Our only comment to improve things would be that the room we stayed in 320 needs updated. Still had a TV with a back!!! Modernisation required but overall good old simple manners won the day so well done to ALL the staff at Boscolo Aleph. Happy to return any day!

Reviews.Title: “a decent 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: togg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst 5 star hotel I have stayed across Europe for many years. Its design is only a fake identity for its 5 star - dont know how they got 5 stars at all! Nothing belonging to 5 star let alone luxury was there. There was no meeting room, roof was not open, neither was its pool, the gym consists of a couple of machines you can even have at home. The breakfast was poor. Cleanness was questionable. The only positive thing about the place was its location and its stuff who treid to be helpful but unfortunately rather unprofessional. There are many other deals at same price with higher standards in Rome so dont short list this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, expensive experience”
Reviews.Author: nanny0
Reviews.Content: Really understaffed at the front desk. Rooms old, tired and not really functioning...missing light bulbs broken switches and lamps. Other rooms had broken ceiling light fixtures that showed the exposed bulbs and window shades that didn't work. I think this hotel needs a huge cash infusion. The only good thing I can say about our four nights there was it's location.

Reviews.Title: “What a disaster; poorly maintained and overpriced for so-called luxury.”
Reviews.Author: Mike_ATL100
Reviews.Content: The best thing I can say about this hotel is that their website was great. Of course, the website over promised on the reality. This is not a luxury hotel. The room was not clean. The tile in the shower was coming up. The baby crib they delivered was broken as was their promise to fix it. The tv only had Italian speaking stations. No concierge on duty our first day in Rome. We checked out the second day and were lucky to find a similarly priced hotel that was everything this place promised to be but was not (in case you are wondering Hotel Fortyseven).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rome1Albany_NY
Reviews.Content: Modern clean luxury hotel in a great location of Rome within walking distance to main attractions like the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, and Spanish Steps. Room was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was fully tiled, very clean, and had a large oversized shower head which provided great comfort after a long day of site seeing. Fabulous extras like soft plush robes and beautifully scented shampoo and lotion. A taxi ride to the Vatican was reasonable at 10 Euros depending on time of day. A double decker tour bus stops at the bottom of the street and is a great way to see the main attractsion of Rome. Hotel is conveniently located near many restaurants and great shops. Loved the photos of Sophia Lauren in the elevators! Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel - Close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: JAC4445
Reviews.Content: Location not far from Rome major attractions. Able to walk to the Spanish Stairs, Trevi Fountain and other attractions. The Colosseum and the Vatican were easily assessable via the train. Rooms were average size and quite adequate. Would have preferred ice, but no ice machines available in the entire hotel. Would definitely recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: romo1026
Reviews.Content: The hotel was strongly recommended to me by my colleague. I was disappointed to first be given a room that had bars on the window with pipes (or air conditioner), making it dark and not conducive to opening my drapes. I asked to be changed as I had booked a superior room. After some resistence from the front desk, I was given a better room and was happy with the accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Look into 5 star before you book here. Its so-so.”
Reviews.Author: SarahandJo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aleph after finding it on the internet while organizing our trip to Europe. Rome was the last leg of our big trip and we had splashed out and got a 5 star hotel after staying in 2 star hotels in other countries. The hotel is beautifully presented on arrival, and the staff were friendly and happy, and could speak a bit of English which was a relief. We got there the day before our hotel room was booked for, and we wanted to stay the extra night and asked if we could get the rate we paid for all the nights we booked for in advanced. They took 8 Euro off the price! We were tired and we didn't care, we just wanted to get up to the room. The rooms are lovely and clean if you compare it to a 3 star hotel, but the title of a luxury hotel, it just doesn't live up to this. The tiles in the shower were black from mold and scum, there was a hole ripped in the bed spread, and the TV was the most frustrating thing, not only was it from the 90's but there wasn't any channels in English. I know we were visitors to this country but we had to watch the CNN channel on the stock market than listen to dubbed over Italian TV. My Fiancee was extremely disappointed in the internet connection, as the price to use the internet was astronomical, it can be up to 20 euro for 24 hours, where in France and London the internet was wireless, and free at faster speed and these were 2-3 star hotels. The Aleph was making a killing off everyone using the internet in the rooms. Stay away from the mini bar also. Its high way robbery, 15 Euro for beers. We bought our own food and ate it in the rooms, but we rang room service to ask for spoons and bowl, they said it was 10 Euro to use the spoon and bowl! Forget it. There was a gym and a wellness spa, also priced out of this world. There is also a time frame, you can only utilize this between 9.30 and 3.30, right in the time slot when we were sight seeing every day. We wanted to swim but there was an attendant who turned us away because it had 'closed' for the day. We don't pay for 5 stars when we cant even use the swimming pools or gym. Apart from the above its quiet and the staff are lovely and friendly and helpful. Its in a fantastic location and we were able to walk to most things, there is also a hop on/hop off bus stop at the top of the street which is good. However would not stay again. I would rather pay less to get the same standard of room and level of disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful and Unwelcoming”
Reviews.Author: mongolikescandy
Reviews.Content: The location is good, and it was quiet. However, there are two main problems with this hotel. Number one, the attitude of the concierge. They were, honestly, plain old lazy and rude. Major bad attitude, too many examples to state here. Number two, the rooftop bar was never open, which was one of the main things we were hoping to use. One night they said it was "sold out", but we went up just to look. There were three people. THREE. All of whom turned and stared us down until we left. We got the feeling the owner was having a private party. The next night they said it was closed due to rain -- it was 75 degrees out. Bizarre. And the main restaurant was taken over by a wedding party, so that was out. The room itself (#413) was average, (a large chair showed up mysteriously the second day, which hadn't been in the room when we checked in) but the balcony was beautiful. Very large. Also, this was the only hotel in Italy that we stayed in that had a bathtub, so that was a plus. Just don't kill yourself on the way to the loo in the middle of the night -- the bathroom is three steps UP from the main room. Another strange thing; we ordered room service the first night and left the tray next to the door outside our room (as suggested) which was never picked up by any of the cleaning staff for the remainder of our 3 day stay. Also, the bed was very hard. Next time we will stay at the Hotel de Russie, which we visited for a drink and was supremley beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel in Rome - so far”
Reviews.Author: GaCare
Reviews.Content: I often find myself in Rome and have stayed in a lot of different hotels - but the Aleph was by far the best. The staff were all friendly and extremely helpful. Going out of their way to do so. The room was very clean and more spacious than the other European hotels. In a great location - walking distance to everything. Would definitely recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing Hotel in Rome with Rooftop Garden”
Reviews.Author: lizzylloyd
Reviews.Content: I travel quite often and stay in really amazing hotels but the Boscolo Aleph is one of the best hotels I have stayed in Europe. From the minute I entered I was greeted by the lovely ENZO who was very accomodating and made sure that we got one of the best rooms -- a room with its own private rooftop terrace overlooking Rome. The room was very comfortable and classy with a beautiful large photograph of the Coliseum and the Sophia Loren fotos in the elevators were a nice touch. The breakfast was also one of the best I have had in Europe. The location was very central to everything -- a couple steps from Via Veneto and easy walking distance to all the sights such as Spanish Steps, Fontana de Trevi, and Piazza del Popolo. I will definitely come back to ALEPH BOSCOLO. Simply Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pricey extras”
Reviews.Author: johnnymaddog
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. Great location, good service, but the extras e.g. the bar, minibar and massages/treatments were excessively expensive. 9 euro for a lemonade. I'd recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel "Bites"”
Reviews.Author: Aweighsin
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on a ten day, sixteenth birthday, adventure across Italy. I was personally very excited to visit such a historic city and experience such a unique and respected culture. However, after our luggage being lost and arriving at the hotel with no baggage to speak of, the service here was less than satisfactory. Our room was nice and clean with a good bathroom. However, when we woke up the next morning my mother had a dead mosquitoes smashed against her forehead and both of us had bites ALL OVER our bodies! We were itchy from head to toe and when we notified the hotel their response was "oh, well it's just that time of year."Are you kidding me?! This is a 4 star hotel! We had no offer of any possible solution to this problem and the only employee even remotely helpful to us was a woman named Valentina. She was the only one who offered to track our baggage online (considering the phone number they gave us at the airport was disconnected), instead of charging us 30 euros a day for internet access. Also the hotel is misleading about how close The Spanish Steps and Colosseum are. Unless you want to walk for over an hour I suggest taking a taxi or using the metro. I would not recommend paying the outrageous price for breakfast, just down the street are plenty of places to find a delicious and much cheaper breakfast! Also when buying a croissant or easily portable food, just buy it and eat it while walking versus paying a tax just for sitting down. Over all our time in Rome was wonderful! If you're staying at this hotel, goodnight and don't let the bed bugs, or in this case mosquitoes, bite!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Simen S
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. We arrived in Rome by train and took a taxi. Unfortunately we paid much more than we should. The hotel told us to expect 10-15 euro from the train station to the hotel. We were met by a very gentle laady that told us about the hotel and its design. Then we got our luggage brought to our room. The room was great – still a hotel room but very nice – big and with a big bathroom. The location of the hotel is perfect. Walking distance to all the main places in central Rome. 5 minutes away from the subway that within minutes will get you to the Colosseum and the Vatican. Silent street as well. We had a tip for a restaurant from a friend in Norway – “Asunta Madre”. The hotel booked a table for us. Seriously the best food/seafood we’ve ever had. And the best thing – ONLY Italians and we got a table outside – guess that’s since they called from Boscolo  Calling it a luxury hotel we had very high expectations. So it’s sad to see that the tiles in the pool/SPA-area was not fixed, the shower in the hotel-room was not updated. Small details but a luxury hotel needs to have the details fixed as well.

Reviews.Title: “They Treated Us Like Kings - Perfect Beginning to Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: StephanieMKE
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel during our honeymoon across Europe. We wanted luxury, but didn't want to spend everything we had on hotel rooms. I found a really good deal for this hotel and was a little nervous that it all seemed too good to be true. We arrive early in the morning on June 22nd and were immediately impressed by the gorgeous lobby and hints of a Heaven/Hell theme in the decor. It was modern, trendy and very hip. Probably too hip for us, but they were so nice to us regardless. As we were checking in, the hotel clerk said he wanted to upgrade our room. I thanked him and told him it was our honeymoon so that was a wonderful surprise. Upon hearing this, he appeared to do something else on the computer and asked if we would be willing to wait one hour for a maid to clean the room he wanted to give us. It was hours before the regular check-in time so waiting an hour was no problem for us, especially for the upgrades. We walked down the street to the Spanish Steps (which are only a couple blocks from the hotel) and then grabbed coffee at a cafe. When we returned they took us to our room -- a beautiful, modern, funky room with a complimentary bottle of champagne for us. Best of all, the room had its very own ROOFTOP TERRACE. Not a balcony, but rather an entire terrace with ivy-covered walls, chaise lounge chairs, little tables and chairs for drinks, etc... and a hot tub that was not being used. We assumed this was a public area, but then we realize there was only one other room that had access to it -- the penthouse suite. During our entire trip we never saw anyone else on the terrace and we drank coffee every morning on it. Never in a million years would I have thought we would have our very own rooftop terrace in Rome. If you stay here, try to book a room on the SIXTH FLOOR to get access to the terrace. Throughout our stay, the front desk staff was incredibly kind and helpful to us. The hotel staff helped us arrange tours, recommended a PHENOMENAL restaurant with some of the best lobster I've ever had, and catered to any request we had. The location was ideal for us. We were up the street from the Triton fountain and within walking distance of many attraction, including the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, etc... The metro station was one block away and we were able to get everywhere on it. I've stayed at some wonderful hotels and this one will always be very special to me. I recommend it to anyone. My only minor negative comment and I'll agree with other posters on this: The restaurant/room service/bar is very pricey. Go down the street if you don't want to spend everything on a so-so meal. Thank you, thank you, THANK YOU, Hotel Aleph, your kindness was so appreciated and we loved your hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Kutty1101
Reviews.Content: We searched Tripadvisor long and hard before going to Italy. Most of our hotels were superb, but the one we picked for our Rome stay was quite disappointing. While the Aleph Boscolo has a fancy lobby, the rest of the hotel lacks. We paid extra for a deluxe room and it was quite ordinary. The drinking glasses were dirty, and the towels a bit scratchy. The bed was the hardest we encountered. We both woke up with sore shoulders each morning. We asked for a wake-up call our last morning, which never arrived. The buffet breakfast was 30 euros each. We opted not to try this. We arrived on a Friday, and was informed that the Spa would be closed the next 2 days (Sat & Sun). We deceided to pay it a Friday Evening visit due to the closure. The colors scheme was relaxing, but the spa pool had tiles breaking off and scattered around the pool floor. There was an attendent in the area who seems overly protective and quite unfriendly. We did not feel welcome, nor able to relax much. It would have been a great concept if done with a more welcoming atmosphere, and maintenance of the pool. The price was over $500 USD a night. In the future, I would opt to stay elsewhere and get more for my money. I would also prefer being closer to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “SPECTATULAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: DCochran
Reviews.Content: I originally discovered this hotel while traveling on business and since then, I continue to stay with Boscolo Aleph for business and for personal travel. Extremely clean, elegant and excellent service. Rooms are spectatular and close to popular sites. Would definately recommend to friends and colleagues and look forward to future stays at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jimchapp
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at the Aleph as part of our honeymoon trip around Italy. We arrived at the hotel from Rome Termini station by using the Metro - our first mistake. Escalators that didnt work had me carrying 2 suitcases up around 100 stairs in the searing heat... if you travel here by train, make sure you get a taxi to the hotel... We arrived in the lobby and it looked great.. We had booked a Superior room for two nights at well over £500 quid, so we were expecting a great room for our money, especially as it was room only, without breakfast. The first thing we were told was that the spa was closed on Saturday (our only full day in Rome) so my wife was unable to have any treatments, which was one of the factors i took into account when booking. Nevertheless, we entered the lift and went up to the correct floor, but then appeared to get out into the travel lodge corridor, not the hotel with the great entrance lobby we had just been in. Very odd. On entering our room, it was very nice, but with nowhere to put our luggage, this made things awkward to say the least. As well as this, the internet connection didnt work, meaning we were guessing our train times when it came to leave. Not a show stopper, but very annoying. On the plus side, the location is great for both exploring Rome and getting to the station (by taxi). If you are looking to book this hotel, make sure you get it very very cheap or you will be as disappointed as i was. I've stayed in a fair few 5 star hotels in my time all over the world, but i could not class this as one of them, regardless of what the brass plaque says on the front door...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms, trendy decor, expensive.”
Reviews.Author: mazd31
Reviews.Content: Hotel was located close to Bernini station and walking distance to Spanish steps, Trevi fountain and restaurants. Nice quiet location. Decor and ambience of hotel was very modern and trendy. Rooms were large, comfortable and clean. On our first night we had 2 double beds joined together. My husband complained and they immediately set up a new room for us with one King bed. Breakfast was not included in the price paid and was quite expensive so we had breakfast at nearby cafes. Mini bar was also extremely expensive and internet was 20 Euro/day! If this hotel offered its clients those added extras like free wi-fi (pretty common nowadays!), breakfast, and a little more of a personal touch it would really stand-out. Overall, good hotel. We enjoyed staying there. But we paid less for other hotels in our stay in Europe and received a lot more for our money. Maybe it was due to the hotel being in Rome?

Reviews.Title: “nice enough but not for that price”
Reviews.Author: jingles70
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed at the Aleph to mark 10 years of union, I had asked for our room to be prepared for a celebration and was expecting flowers or chocolates at the very least. I was extremely disappointed to find a bog standard room with no attempt to decorate it for our arrival. The hotel is lovely and feels quite luxurious, a superior room though is not what you might think. it is very small, has one English speaking channel on the sky TV. Our first night was spent in darkness due to a power failure on the fuse box in our room, we were offered a change of room at 1am! we decided to struggle though but hadnt realised the room would be pitch dark in the morning. To top it all the shower door fell off its runners! there is no window in the bathroom so it was in complete darkness! We complained at reception and assured they would take care of it for us whilst we were out for the day. The problem was sorted but no upgrade or bottle of wine, nothing for our inconvenience! The staff are very nice - immaculately turned out ! he spa is lovely. be warned - we bought a beer and a coke and the bill was 16 euros!! a meal in the hotel restaurant is 115 euros each. As a recommendation we did the segway tour around Rome which runs for approx 3 hours at a cost of £67 each, Fantastic!!! Overall a nice enough hotel but expected more for our £350 per night, a gorgeous city, fantastic segway tour, and an unforgettable surprise when my partner proposed to me next to the Trevi fountain!!

Reviews.Title: “Very bad value for money”
Reviews.Author: LizaCrotty
Reviews.Content: Keep looking is what I say, we paid an outrageous price average 400 per night, for what we got. The room size was very very small, only a queen sized bed (which in my opinion is a single), the shower was a very tight fit (I'm not a big person), no space to fit a chair in the room. The service while with a smile was awful, no hair dryer or safe in my room and it took a few hours to get a replacements, we needed a plug adapter but they had none, no wifi in the room but we could buy a card for 10euro which got us 30minutes of broadband. Breakfast wasn't included and cost a flat rate of 20e per person and it was so basic it was a total rip off. It has left a very bad impression of rome for me. Liza

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: boutique-hotel-fan2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights beginning of May. It was our first time in Rome and it was special as we were celebrating our 2 yr anniversary. Even though this hotel was kind of expensive it looked really chic so we decided to treat ourselves. ...It wasn't worth it at all. If I have spent half of what i have paid I would have been satisfied with what i got...but with those prices it just doen't do it for me. The room's size is ok but is in immediate need of renovation! I heard another couple complaining that their shower wasn't working properly. The walls in the shower room were cracked. Nothing special about it at all, just a simple 3-star-hotel room.The view was an office building across the street. Note that the price did not include breakfast (!) and after reading some of the reviews here i didnt even want to try it for 20 euro per person. I can't say anything about the food and the spa as I haven't tried any of them. The pros of this hotel are the location which was excellent as you can walk almost everywhere and the service. Everyone was very friendly and very willing to help. I would't recommend a friend to stay at this hotel as it is definitely not worth what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Would definatly go back!”
Reviews.Author: nataliabiggs
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stopped at the Boscolo hotel for 3 nights in Rome. As soon as we arrived you could tell it was a 5 star hotel. There were concierge to open the doors for you and carry your case inside, and as soon as you got to the reception desk the staff were friendly, helpful and attentive. The room was lovely and clean and maids came round every morning to change your sheets and towels. Although we didnt eat at the hotel due to the cost, the menu was diverse. There was a lovely spa with a steam room, sauna and jacuzzi to end a full day of sight seeing, and they were always stacked plentyful with fresh towels and dressing gowns!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely different and delightful”
Reviews.Author: FairyNuffManchester
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an amazing weekend in Rome staying at this Heaven and Hell themed hotel in the swanky part of town. The samurai wariors who greet you stand at the entrance of the hotel lobby which is kitted out in demonic reds and blacks but the staff are like little angels. They were the friendliest, most helpful and most charming hosts and their pride in their hotel shone through. They couldn't wait to show us round and point out the little idiosyncracies of the design and tell us a bit of the history of the building. The spa is a dream and just what you neeed after a hard day site seeing. Our room was small but perfectly formed with a view over the backgammon courtyard complete with giant dice - I did say it was a bit different!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but definitely not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Victoria721
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aleph to celebrate our one year anniversary. When we arrived at around 6:00 pm, there was no one to help us with our luggage. We got to the front desk, however, and the staff was friendly and welcoming. That same night, when we returned from dinner, we ordered drinks at the lobby bar, only to be told that the bar had been rented out to a group and we could not be in the area. We would have to take our drinks elsewhere. (A whiskey and a beer cost nearly $50.00 USD) When we asked the bartender if he would mind taking a picture of us he found it necessary to remind us that we could not be in the area and did not take the picture. The room and bathroom were spacious and clean. Location was excellent! Steps away from the Barberini Metro Station, minutes from the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. Plenty of shops and restaurants in the area. My husband and I stay at 5 star hotels all the time and this hotel does not match the description. There are so many hotels to choose from, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced, Over rated....”
Reviews.Author: sgj70
Reviews.Content: A big disappointment! We got a discounted stay at the Aleph, and to be honest I would have been furious if I had paid full price. Even with the free night, its still over priced. The rooms were small, but well furnished, breakfast was included in my rate but VERY limited, the business centre was not available (the manager let me use his PC to check my flights), the bar was closed for a function, and toilets had a curtain sellotaped to the walls as the door was broken.... There was no security viewer in the door either. On the upside, the location is great – near Berberini metro station (handy for Termini and then the airport), local bus stops, taxis nearby etc some good bars/restaurants nearby and the Spanish Steps about 10 min walk away. With limited time in Rome, we didnt use the spa (when we did go to look at it, it was closed - but the spa prices are scary!) The staff were also friendly and helpful, expect the doorman who couldn’t accept I can carry my own bags and then never bothered opening the door for us again, and the bar staff – it took 2 of them to get me some ice. Dont get me wrong, this was a comfortable place to stay, but I stay away a lot for both work and leisure, and this was about a 3 – 4 star standard.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but great location and service”
Reviews.Author: love2travelTokyo
Reviews.Content: Contrary to some of the other reviews, we had a fabulous stay at the Aleph for 2 nights on our 2.5 week Italian odyssey. Pros - Location is fantastic....metres from Piazza Barberini and 5 min walk to Spanish Steps area - Very funky albeit slightly scary lobby area. As many have noted, there is a heaven / hell theme - Had a decent sized room with very modern funky bathroom including our own jacuzzi. Furnishings were modern, but not ultra modern...looks maybe 10 years old - Spa / sauna / pool area was also very funky, although the gym is very small and the water in the jacuzzi was too cold - Had fantastic service including an Asian hotel style welcome with a sitdown briefing Cons - got a small discount off expedia, but was still exxy. May have expected something a little better for the price? - Breakfast was ok, not worth the cost though (I think it was 20 Euros?) Other things to note: Well worth heading to Travestere for food....the restaurant Carlo Menta was very good and very cheap. We also did a Vatican tour arranged through the concierge for around 59 Euros per person...well worth it to have someone explain things and have a hassle free experience...we had a fantastic guide called Carlotta.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the splendid time...”
Reviews.Author: tomatvie
Reviews.Content: The hotels design and cordiality of the staff has been great. Also the organisational specials for our 14 month old daughter worked excellent. A small draw- back might be the cleanlyness of the pool area, where a little decalcification and small parts repair could increase the look and feel of the great design significantly. Location wise the hotel is a perfect starting point to visit the historical center of Rome and its shopping area near the Spanish steps. A place to return to!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elkies
Reviews.Content: Poor, poor. poor. And we would have been when we left if we had eaten and used room service more than we did. When we did use room service, they got it wrong both times. The lobby is dark and cold and the barman clearly does not wish to work. The bar prices are 5* prices but the hotel is probably no more than a 3* hotel. The dog having a poo picture ont he bedroom wall leaves a lot to be desired and the wardrobe door hurts when it falls off its runners on to your head. The spa should open at 9.00 am at weekends. I was actually cold in sauna and steam room at 11.00 am and wonder if the power is a problem in the hotel having read a previous review and finding the lobby and spa dark and cold. The spa also has a mens urinal smell and is not the heaven it is supposed to be. The gym equipment would probably be fine at a 3* hotel but it didn't even tempt me to put on my kit. Altogether, our weekend was a dissapointment - we went to Rome for the weekend to watch the rugby. England won but they didn't play well. However, Rome is fantastic but don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: sailorcharlie
Reviews.Content: There's a real "whoa" effect as you walk in this hotel which is basically done out in black and red on the theme of heaven and hell. Personally we found much heaven and no hell at all other than the interior design references. Lovely staff, comfy beds, great location. Can't find a bad thing to say about it. We'll be back soon I hope.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing from the outside, not so amazing once inside!”
Reviews.Author: Hotel-Inspector99
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Boscolo Aleph with my wife on our honeymoon, as you can imagine we expected the 5 star rating and the 5 star price tag to go hand in hand with a 5 star service but were sadly disappointed with the lack of staff, service and the hotel in general. It didnt make us feel too enthused with Rome but thankfully the wonderful sights and food the rest of Rome had to offer made up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Not really a 5 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: princesa75
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to our bedroom, the bathroom floor was not totally clean in fact it had pubic hairs in different places, also the shower door din not close properly so when we had a shower water will spill out to the floor!, we informed all of these situations the the receptionist, we did get a note of apologies from the management about the bathroom floor and they even gave as a bottle of champagne, which when we finished with, we left outside our room to be collected, however this was only picked up the next day in the evening! On the early hours of the 1st of Jan/10 we had 2 or 3 power cuts and every time that the power was reestablished the light in our bedroom would switched itself on -we were already sleeping-. We thought that this hotel was exaggeratedly expensive, I mean breakfast £20 or £30 using the room service facility? maybe if all the other little things wouldn't had happen we wouldn't have minded! We did not think of this hotel as a 5 star it was more like 4.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: Eva037
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband were spending our honeymoon at the Boscolo Hotel Aleph. We booked it through easy click web site and indeed it was easy and quick. The service at the hotel was exceptional and I enjoyed every minute. It was the most romantic honeymoon. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Great Design Hotel but no ambience”
Reviews.Author: Akrut
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an up scale, hip, design hotel for my stay in Rome with my wife and I found the Aleph. We found the hotel to be perfect in every way except the ambience. The disign is great ,don't get put off by the Heaven/ Hell theme they talk about, we only noticed it because we had read about it. We were picked up at the airport and arrived to the hotel at around 8:30 pm on a Friday night, we entered a very cool lobby with a nice bar and a couple of lounge type rooms but it was completely empty, not a single person having a drink and no music what so ever. Reception staff told us to go to the roof top restaurant/bar. Got to our room which was great, we had a deck bigger than the actual room and a great bathroom, due to the time zone change we wanted to shower, change and go out to get acclimated to the new time zone. So we head to the roof top bar and again empty. This went on for the whole weekend, the hotel was pretty much dead untill Monday morning when a big group of business men checked in for a meeting or something. Now we were not planning on hanging out at our hotel while in Rome but we did pick this place thinking it would have a little bit of fun and ambiance. I think they are missing out on a lot of food and beverage business, they need to hire a good PR person. Other than that the place is in a good location with great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilyina_n
Reviews.Content: The Aleph Hotel won the Best Hotel Interior Design in Europe at the 2004 Villegiature Awards that were held on October 18 at the Bristol hotel in Paris with the participation of ambassadors, diplomats, directors of renown luxury hotels and resorts and major publishers. Featured in "Top 25 Hot New Hotels in Italy" in Travel and Leisure (September 2004).

Reviews.Title: “Cool Decor, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: gershiwin
Reviews.Content: The theme at this hotel is heaven and hell which is actually pretty unusual. My daughters thought it was the coolest hotel they've been in. It was nice but listed as a 5 star hotel which I don't agree with. More like 4 stars. The staff was nice and the breakfast was good. Nice, clean rooms with great bathrooms. The location was good, close to the Spanish Steps and the subway. I wish we would've used the subway- we were afraid we'd get lost. But we did try it on our way home and it was fine. We would've saved a lot of money spent on taxis by taking the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: azrunbunny
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the recent reviews, I was very nervous. I had to come back and write a review about how nice our stay was. They must have hired new staff because every single person we interacted with at the hotel was as helpful as could be. There were always 2-3 people working the desk and their English was quite good. Our room was clean and appeared fairly recently appointed. The decor was fun and funky - much like a "W" in the states. Yes, the food and drinks were expensive, but not out of proportion to other trendy places in Rome. Even though the mini bar had that electronic charging feature, the staff was happy to remove items we didn't actually use. Finally the location was excellent. Very close to Spanish steps and wonderful shopping. Rome is very much a walking city, so you could actually walk to the Vatican and Coliseum in 20 min or so.

Reviews.Title: “Closer to a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYC1240
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Aleph was a bit of a dissapointment for us, you are probaby better off going to price line and putting in a price for a 4 star hotel than staying at the Aleph. Below is my honest assesment. It is closer to a 3 star hotel vs 4 star. Lobby Lobby is cool and they have a happy hour from 4-7 pm, drinks are roughly $12 Euros at happy hour (check your bill though because sometimes they don't put the happy hour prices on). Food We didn't eat at the hotel, breakfast buffet was $30 Euros and if you want room service - forget it, the delivery charge is $20 Euros - that is crazy! Extras Internet in the room is $29 Euros a day Movies in the room at $20 Euros Service For the most part people are friencly, however, there was one guy on the night shift behind the desk and he was the rudest person I have met in all of my travels. We asked for recommendations for places (there is no conceirage) and it was a bit of a struggle to get him to write it down. OUr television in our room was broken, we asked him to send someone to service it, when we got back and asked if they managed to fix the television he just said 'no' - at a certain point it became comical. we asked for information about the spa at the hotel (there was no brochure) and he was very unhelpful... anyway, the service really was not great. Rooms The rooms are average, the queen/king beds are 2 twins pushed together. The bathrooms are nice and modern. Gym/Spa The gym is very limited and its by the spa desk/change room. The gym has maybe 4-5 machines, one bench and a few free weights.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel - Closer to a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYC1240
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Aleph was a bit of a dissapointment for us, you are probaby better off going to price line and putting in a price for a 4 star hotel than staying at the Aleph. Below is my honest assesment. It is closer to a 3 star hotel vs 4 star. Lobby Lobby is cool and they have a happy hour from 4-7 pm, drinks are roughly $12 Euros at happy hour (check your bill though because sometimes they don't put the happy hour prices on). Food We didn't eat at the hotel, breakfast buffet was $30 Euros and if you want room service - forget it, the delivery charge is $20 Euros - that is crazy! Extras Internet in the room is $29 Euros a day Movies in the room at $20 Euros Service For the most part people are friencly, however, there was one guy on the night shift behind the desk and he was the rudest person I have met in all of my travels. We asked for recommendations for places (there is no conceirage) and it was a bit of a struggle to get him to write it down. OUr television in our room was broken, we asked him to send someone to service it, when we got back and asked if they managed to fix the television he just said 'no' - at a certain point it became comical. we asked for information about the spa at the hotel (there was no brochure) and he was very unhelpful... anyway, the service really was not great. Rooms The rooms are average, the queen/king beds are 2 twins pushed together. The bathrooms are nice and modern. Gym/Spa The gym is very limited and its by the spa desk/change room. The gym has maybe 4-5 machines, one bench and a few free weights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay on our Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Marie C
Reviews.Content: My husband picked this as a surprise honeymoon in Rome and he was not wrong! Its a fab, funky, upmarket hotel, with ace red and black decor! a Heaven and Hell theme with the main hotel being Hell and the Spa of course ..Heaven! We didnt think much of the bedrooms though considering the price and the rest of the hotel frankly the rooms are a let down and the bathroom in a very bad position in the room quite embarrassing actually as there is only a sliding door between your partner and the loo, sing loudly or run the shower ! The restaurant was superbly decorated and the menu good although again a high price but you get what you pay for here. Great location easy to find, a fairly pricey but good base for sightseeing this BEAUTIFUL city, We lova Roma!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel, especially for the deal that we found”
Reviews.Author: andr0meda16
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at this hotel - it was clean, comfortable, modern, and convenient. However, I don't think it's worth staying here for the full price. The deal we got was E170/night for an upgraded room (to Deluxe) with breakfast included; normal price on the website was double that (around E400 ) for the Deluxe room. The Hotel - The hotel was clean, updated, modern, with a touch of edgy decorating scheme. The staff was friendly and helpful - when we decided to extend our stay there, the staff even helped us get an extension to our deal. They also sent a bottle of champagne our first night (I think it was because we mentioned that it was our anniversary).
