Breakfast was OK - they had the same items everyday but there were a fair amount of warm and cold selections. It's nice that hot drinks were included in the breakfast, they had very good coffee. The spa facilities was ok, we only used the spa once. The whirlpool was not kept as well as it could have and the water was just luke warm but they do have some work out equipments. The Room - We got upgraded to a Deluxe room as part of our deal -t we had more than enough space, especially for a European hotel. The bed was large and comfortable. The room was also clean, updated, and had modern decors. The bathroom was clean and updated (part of the mirror by the sink was even heated so that it does not fog up after shower). The bathtub was skinnier than normal but not a big deal. The TV channel selection was also limited, but again not a big deal. Location - The hotel was tucked away in a smaller street in the Via Veneto area but it was very convenient. There are a few buses that stop in front of the hotel that went to the major sights. The Barberini piazza is at the end of the block where many more bus lines stop and there is a metro stop as well. If you plan on taking public transportation, this hotel seems to be a lot more convenient than some of the hotels further up Via Veneto. There are a few restaurants around though the ones up Via Veneto are very overpriced. Our experience at this hotel certainly made our stay in Rome even more fun and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: siandl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a weekend break for the Wales Italy game. Lovely hotel - nice rooms, with a comfy largte bed - also quiet, could not hear the usual hustle and bustle which wakes me up in a hotel. Staff were very helpful , although I felt sorry for the solitary barman - who also had to sort out the room service (which could leave y ou waiting for a drink for a while !) Would avoid room service - a charge of 20 euro applies on top of the menu price ! Did not have breakfast included (so could not comment) - but Cafe Roma just around corner - where you can enjoy breakfast in the italian sunshine. It was a convenient location, for buses and metro. A short walk from spanish steps , and to the dolce vita area.Due to extra-curricular activites, could not comment on spa (we just did not have time). Can't wait to return again. Bella Roma. Oh yes - the private driver - Mauro, used by the hotel was lovely !! Competitive rate for airport tranfer. (Paid £380 for flight from Heahrow and 3 night stay, no breakfast, expedia)

Reviews.Title: “Loved Aleph in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Simona70
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Aleph hotel on December 2008 and we had a wonderful time. We were two adults with one 5 year old boy and we booked a deluxe room, which was very spacious for 3 people. I love the design of this hotel, which is very modern and striking all in black and red. I was a little bit worried as I had read some bad comments about this hotel, but on the contrary our stay at Aleph was wonderful: the room was beautiful and clean, the service faultless and the location is also great as as you can reach all the main attraction with a few minute walk. Also the breakfast was good and with a wide choice of proposals - the room where breakfast is served is also gorgeous! I would certainly recommend this hotel for your stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary meets Comfort!”
Reviews.Author: JogaBonito
Reviews.Content: At first, it's hard to find by foot when you're in a foreign country! It's located on a small unpopular street. But once you arrive... It's gorgeous! The doorman was always more than courteous. Very friendly and had great advice to offer when prompted. He was always very helpful! The concierge and front-desk staff were okay, a bit snooty, but still somewhat courteous. Although the room itself was relatively small (for $300 a night!) it was tastefully decorated and very comfortable. The bathroom was even gorgeous! Rain-shower head, scented lotions and bodywash in full-size tubes (not the minis you get at regular hotels!), glass sink...very sleek and modern. The enitre hotel, lobby, rooms, hallways, was all contemporary/modern in its design. The pool/hot tub were gorgeous - unfortunately, we never had the time to go! We were always out and about! The location of the hotel is excellent if you plan to go sight-seeing through Rome. There's a subway station at the end of the street, and that streets leads in to one of the many "piazzas" throughout the city. Termini station is a 15-minute walk away! (yes, we actually walked the cobblestone with our wheeled suitcases! Crazy but it likely saved us at least 10 Euros or about $20!) Although the subway station is close, you'll find you can walk to just about anywhere (except the Vatican) within 20 minutes. And you'll see so much more than you would if you took the "metro" (i.e. subway). I strongly recommend this hotel if you're on a honeymoon or if you can really afford to spend $300 per night! If not, stay somewhere cheaper or in a hostel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kellie21
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, perfect location, a 5 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain which is great. Absolutely stunning reception area, very classy. The only down falls were: We went in the middle of August and were looking forward to chilling with a couple of cocktails on the roof terrace bar but when we got there we were told the roof terrace was closed. The spa was also closed for the majority of time we were there. The bar seemed to have run out of everything we tried to order (I tried to order at least 3 cocktails but they did not have the ingredients to make them!). But to be quite honest this didn't really bother us much, after all, why would we want to go to the most beautiful city in the world just to sit in our hotel!? Cannot fault the staff, they were very friendly and couldn't do enough for you, they even gave us a free upgrade upon arrival. All in all, a great place to stay to get the most out of your visit to Rome, I would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “4* Yes, 5* No.”
Reviews.Author: FattMatt
Reviews.Content: This 5* hotel promises much, from the funky decor to the underground spa on the surface the 5* seem well deserved. But dig a little deeper and one starts to wonder if those 5*s are just ticks in boxes! The entrace, bar and dining areas have clearly been heavily invested in! Trendy red colour scheme, art and "hell" as the theme give the hotel a quirky edge. The room? Modern, well done, but not really in keeping with the entrance. The carpet was a little worn, out dated padded wall paper, and a little more attention to detail in the maintenance just make you think that it lacks some love from the staff. The spa was odd. The wall were so heavily limescaled that it felt like sand paper, and there was a huge number of tiles damaged or missing, though still worth visiting (we went every night!) Don't get me wrong, 4*s would be well deserved, very plesant ,but for the price one could expect to pay (over £300 a night) you just want that little extra. We got a 1/3 off and a free upgrade when we booked through Expedia, and for this price it was well worth it! We had a great time, location is great, and facilities are good, but make sure you get a good discount before considering this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: bfhk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a weekend break in August. On first glance the hotel looks great. It is located on a nice quiet side street ,but close enough to walk to some of the central sights (Trevi Fountain etc). The lobby looks very high spec and the lounge is well turned out too. We found the staff very helpful on both check-in and check-out. The main problem with this hotel is that as soon as you leave the lobby and exit the lift, you appear to have been transported to a low-end budget hotel. The corridors on the room level look like something from an bog standard 3 star hotel, clean and tidy but not exactly high end. The room itself was not better. The design was basic too say the least. Cheap wooden wardrobes and headboards look completely out of place. Our room has two drawers in the wardrobe that were broken and could not be used while the shower had loose tiles. The rooms however were not the biggest problem we had during our stay. Breakfast (which at least was included in our rate of c.€250 per night) is not worth paying for and I would recommend getting a rate without it included. On both mornings it was cold (scrambled eggs, bacon etc) and soggy. The bread was stale and the toaster didn't work. The other odd thing about this hotel is that fact that we barely saw another guest during our entire stay. I cannot comment on the roof top bar or other facilities as we did not use these. On the whole, if you are looking for a decent hotel in a good location this hotel might be for you, but it is not worth the rates charged and is not high end.....or even boutique level.....very very average.

Reviews.Title: “good, but seriously overpriced!!”
Reviews.Author: 44rl44
Reviews.Content: We didn't intend to stay in this hotel, but when we got to Rome we found our hotel had closed down so expedia put us here instead. First impressions were very good, the red and black lobby is very striking and the desk staff were friendly enough and upgraded our room to a king. The room looked good (I especially liked the arched ceiling) and was a decent size for a city hotel with massive mirrored wardrobes and loads of drawer space. It was also extremely quiet with regard to any street noise, but there was some kind of air vent in the corridor opposite which was pretty loud at night. However, on close inspection, the room was pretty shabby. There was a big rip in the carpet, marks on the wall and damage to the furniture. The bedroom was very clean but there was black mould around the bottom of the shower. The bed was pretty hard and was two small beds pushed together that were slightly different heights so there was a big ridge in the middle! Overall we were happy with the hotel but if we'd paid the going rate i have to say I'd be furious! Based on the room there is no way this is a 5 star hotel, i have stayed in 3 star hotels that were just as nice. The location is excellent though!

Reviews.Title: “Too little for $$$$$”
Reviews.Author: itsmari
Reviews.Content: Well, it is a nice masculine hotel, I will give it that. But for most of our 3 day stay, there was no doorman. It rained a lot, and they handed us a cheap umbrella that the vendors sell on the street. It broke 20 minutes later. For the price paid...over $500 US a night, I would expect service. But the price looks like you pay for the design and decor. You have to pay for internet, breakfast was $22 EU and on our honeymoon, they put us near the generator on the FIRST FLOOR. Am I expecting too much for my dollar? If i were to go to Rome again, I would stay at the Hotel de Russie. Its a little bit more, but there is a HUGE difference in service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stehuges
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very well located in Via veneto area and you can find plenty of great restaurants nearby. I was impressed by the trendy decoartion of this hotel at first sight, . The rooms was not so spacious but well equipped. The very negative point of this hotel is the high rate they charge you for accommodation and every single extra you buy.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Stels
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome for a long weekend as a birthday treat from my boyfriend. First impressions were WOW...the hotel decorated to a very high standard, the staff were very friendly, and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Only downside was the breakfast which wasn't all that. It was edible, but wasn't anything particularly exciting. In addition, the prices for drinks there were VERY expensive. We were going to watch a movie on the tv one night but that was 14euros, which is a bit excessive. I did however thoroughly enjoy myself, and if you do go to the hotel bar, food is laid on (not your standard pistachio nuts). The barman bought out 7 dishes of food!! Caviar on toast, croquettes, little ham sandwiches, rocks of cheese...and much more, all of which were very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Something different”
Reviews.Author: Amoras
Reviews.Content: Aleph Boscolo Hotel is a beautiful hotel (it seems to be a museum) in a quiet street in the center of Rome. It’s 10-13 min. walk to piazza di Spagna. The same time to Fontana di Trevi.. Also it’s 100 m to Metro Station ( Barberini) in the case of visit something by train. As you can see from travelers photos, the entrance of aleph hotel (except from the 2 old Lions – right & left – it’s a modern art place. If u like the colors of Black & Red, then you may feel like being in your place. All these are about the reception, bar & restaurant area. (The staff was cool & expected accommodated). Getting to the rooms, there is “White & Blue”. Our room was comfortable and a little bit bigger than others. (It’s the last of the right side of the 1st floor). Notice that when we asked for an ashtray in our room, they answered, “it’s a non smoking Hotel”. (As you’re going to see, everybody smokes on the road. Out of shops, bars, restaurants and everywhere). There is a beautiful Open Roof Restaurant on the 7th floor. That’s all… no special View… Almost everything in the Hotel is Pricey, however, this is the Hotel & it’s your choice to stay or not…the eccentricity is paid.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly NOT a Luxury Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EssexGurkha
Reviews.Content: The Aleph is certainly not a Luxury Class hotel. We booked this hotel because of the overall reputation of the Boscolo chain, because we wanted somewhere a bit different to celebrate a birthday trip to visit our daughter and her partner who live in Milan and who were joining us on our trip to Rome and because we wanted somewhere central and with its own restaurant as we were arriving late and thought we may not want to go out on our first evening. The foyer and bar area is certainly "interesting" but the rooms are pretty standard for a good city hotel - although the showers are better than some I have used! However what lets the Aleph down is the restaurant and the breakfast. At dinner the food was cold (same meals sent back twice - how can a restaurant in a luxury hotel NOT be able to cook a simple steak or sea bass to perfection!!))and not very interesting - the "selection of grilled vegetables" turned out to be 6 pieces of courgette - each about the size of a 2 euro coin. Three scoops of indifferent vanilla icecream - selection was vanilla, stawberry or chocolate - for 15 euros. Breakfast was tinned peaches or pears or apples, standard "out of the box" cereals - but no muesli, playing "hunt the cutlery" for knives and forks (and waiters) cold scrambled egg and bacon - again - and when we asked for jam we were given a plate of individual jars - one if which had been opened and used. What made it all more amusing was sitting in the bar and watching the Boscolo promotion loop - showing fabulous food, amazing breakfast buffets, attentive waiters - but not at the Aleph! To be fair the managers were excellent and did all they could to resolve our problems and for this reason - and the location alone - we might be tempted to chose the Aleph if we went to Rome again - provided their restaruant is improved.

Reviews.Title: “Very mixed feelings about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dhp44
Reviews.Content: I chose to book a room here based on photos and a few reviews I'd read. It was expensive, but it looked like it would warrant the extra cost. It appeared safe, in a good part of town, conveniently located and all of the stuff you look for as a traveler in a large city. Here's the deal: The lobby decor is interesting and well done but the rooms fail to live up to the standard set by the lobby. I got a great rate on the room, which was the only reason I chose it frankly. The hotel staff were very hot/cold. A few of them were very attentive and friendly. Just as many were cold and seemed to stare you down as you entered and left the building. There were a few times when I felt very unwelcome simply leaving to go out on the town. The desk seemed always busy and if you needed something, it seemed you were getting in their way. One member in particular was very friendly and helpful but I have to admit, I didn't ask for anything or need anything in particular during my stay. One thing I will mention is that bath tubs in rome seem rare and this one had jacuzzi jets, which was great after days upon days of walking around rome. The bathroom was fairly large and clean...also rare in Rome, it would seem. Overall, simply not worth the cost if you have to book at full price. What you're getting is mostly artifice...some hip furnishings and red lighting around the lobby and bar area. Speaking of which, cans of coke for $11.00 and bottles of water for $9.00? ARE YOU KIDDING ME? ALL of the services are WAY overpriced, including internet connection. Everything in the hotel seemed to be be an effort to get you to spend more, more, more and tip, tip, tip. If I am paying to stay in YOUR hotel, treat me as a guest, offer me some value, some deals and ease the pains of my travel and hard days of wandering around. Instead, they seemed to be there at every turn making my trip much more expensive than it could have been or should have been. If someone is dropping around $1,000 per night (I certainly didn't, but that was the going rate posted on the inside door) and you can't offer them some complimentary bottles of water or soda or carry the bags up to the room without scratching your hand for a tip, YOU HAVE NOTHING TO OFFER THE TRAVELER. A hotel should be there to make your stay pleasant and easier, not act as a conduit to make it twice as expensive as it has to be. Because you're putting a 50 cent bottle of water in my room fridge, you'll charge me Seven Euros to drink it as a convenience? That tells you everything you need to know about this hotel and how much they're trying to 'help' make their guests stay as enjoyable as possible. I was surprised they didn't try to charge me for using the soap and lotion that was located in the bath room. Honestly, I just felt like I was impeding on their property and not like I was a guest who was wanted or made to feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Hip boutique hotel on a quiet street”
Reviews.Author: YetAnotherViajera
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Aleph twice now and love it. The decor is incredible - dark lobby guarded by two sets of red Samurai armor, behind which is the bar (looks like a big ice cube). The staff is (mostly) accommodating, the restaurant is great, the location is great, the street is quiet. I wish I had a photo of the spa ... its "pool" (for wading, not swimming) is a lush maze of sleek, sparkly pools and waterfalls linked together through cool passageways. On our first visit our room was too tiny - the website says 25 square meters, and we couldn't quite visualize what that was like. Turns out that the room was just big enough for our queen-size bed and a couple of feet of free space on each side, and the 25 square meters must include the bathroom and closet. The furniture is built in, so the space is efficiently used ... but it was tight. On our second visit we sprang for a slightly larger room (35 square meters), and that made all the difference. One disturbing thing: We came back to our room one day during our second stay at the hotel, and the room safe wouldn't open. We called the front desk; they sent up someone who manually opened the safe and re-set the combination. I later found that about US $200 had been stolen from the passport wallet I'd locked in the safe - so, our conclusion is that someone who has the key needed to manually open and re-set the safe combinations must have broken in, stolen the money, and re-set the combination (which explains why we were unable to ope the safe with the combination we'd created). The hotel did nothing about it - didn't even respond to the letter I sent when back in the US. Of course, we know about the disclaimers on room safes - 'you agree that you're leaving stuff here at your own risk, etc.' - so had no recourse. I now lock my stuff in my suitcase rather than using room safes; it feels more like a lesson about the false safety of room safes than about this particular hotel. This one episode notwithstanding, we love the hotel and will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the decor”
Reviews.Author: dublass82
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel. Excellent location. Couldnt find the street intitially on any map but it was just off Piazzi Barberini. Mini bar, restaurant and main bars should be avoided at all costs due to the ridiculous prices. We had a choice of buying 3 bottles of Peroni in the local Spar for €2.98 or paying €12 for one bottle in the bar. We chose the drinking in the room with Spar bottles option. Decor was class - Love the whole heaven and hell thing.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury without pomp”
Reviews.Author: wellensian
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here with my family. This is a boutique hotel of recent design, so offered all the comforts of a 4-5* hotel, without the chandeliers and uniformed flunkeys waiting for tips. On the contrary, the staff were attentive, welcoming and happy to go the extra mile (e.g. confirming flights and printing boarding passes). Decor is unusual, based on Dante's inferno, and designed for fun...there are even large Play Stations in the lobby! The Spa, pool and gym, free and exclusive to hotel guests was particularly welcome for chilling out between a day's sightseeing and going out in the evening. The rooms are restful and beautifully decorated and equipped. Some are on the small side for a luxury hotel, but the corner rooms are spacious with excellent bathrooms. Location is ideal just off the Piazza Barbarini; most of the sights are within easy walking distance, the bus to the Vatican stops outside the door and the Metro is only 100m away. I would have no hesitation in booking here again and would recommend it for all but those looking for a Ritz environment, young children and the elderly..

Reviews.Title: “not bad certainly not luxury”
Reviews.Author: westernforce1
Reviews.Content: a niche hotel not for every one, easy walking distance to most rome sights, skip breakfast have it with the locals at the snack bar located in the nearby square. silva was very pleasant at check in not the unfriendly person i expected, rooms very small no plasma tv, just a small portable and they call this a luxury hotel, the star rating here is dubious at best. overall,location yes, 5 star no

Reviews.Title: “Not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Traveler825
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very unique. It is modern and randomly decorated with samurai warriors, zebra chairs, and bright bold colors. We had no particular problems with the staff but they weren't friendly or welcoming. If you have children I wouldn't recommend this hotel. Their pool is small, connected to the spa, and the children we were with flooded the entire area very easily :-{ Its in a great location, on a quite street but also right near several great cafes and restaurants. The subway is also a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Style over Substance”
Reviews.Author: CityTravellerWindsor
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on this site before booking I looked past what I thought were just a few bad service experiences and concentrated on the design and location of the hotel as these are quite often the main features myself and my partner look for. These two aspects did indeed prove to be the only saving graces of our 4 night stay. The location of the hotel was good, our room was comfortable and the spa pool was nice That said, this hotel's star rating must surely only have been achieved by the style of the hotel and spa etc as it is certainly not from them providing any type of good service. We tried on a couple of occasions to phone/find a concierge of which there was no trace. We could not even obtain an iron and were instead offered a laundry service, which was about 9 euros an item. I agree with other comments in that the reception staff were very rude, and barely acknowledging our arrival did not get us off to the best of starts. In addition, we questioned the 28 Euros per person charged for an extremely poor breakfast, by any european standards, and found ourselves haggling every morning over the fact it was so poor. Finally, I would also stress that the restaurants on the Via Veneto a couple of minutes walk away are extremely overpriced and should be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “A big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: puss79
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Aleph in Rome. I was really looking forwards to staying in this hotel. I had read that it was a really stylish, modern hotel and I expected so much. I was let down from the start. The receptionists were extremely rude, and made us feel as though we were really wasting their time. We had to move rooms at first, as there was a split in the carpet, and was pulling up from the floor which was really dangerous. The next room was better, although the walls were filthy and there were tiles missing from the bathroom walls. Most of the lights in the halls were wonky where someone had not bothered to fix them on properly. This was not the standard that I had expected from this hotel. There was no care and attention, to what I expected to be a luxurious and well run hotel. I know that hotel bars can be expensive, but this hotel was ridiculously priced...6euro for a yoghurt at breakfast, come on...we're not idiots!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible receptionist!”
Reviews.Author: LucyT7
Reviews.Content: Silvia should not be on reception, very rude and not at all accomodating. She made us feel that we had made an error in our booking - I would generally expect a welcome! Would definately not go back. Spent £200 per night on the room, a bellini was £20 (each) don't mind spending money but that just seemed excessive! Leave Silvia to be rude to others and check out the Hotel de Russie!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: saratoga4
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Aleph Hotel, a Boscolo Luxury Hotel, in Rome during July. The hotel has a great location near Place Barberini and the Via Venetto. The hotel is 4-years old and located in what use to be a bank. Style...style...style....this hotel is stylish, in a very contemporary way. It looks like it came out of one of those HGTV design shows. It was very nice. We had reserved 2 rooms (at the lowest rate available); one of our rooms was upgraded, and this room was very large. It included two single beds, a chaise lounge, plenty of storage, and a very large bathroom. Our second room was smaller, but it still had a king bed, a reasonable amount of storage, and a nice size bathroom. The beds were very comfortable and the linens, robes, and towels were high quality. The rooms were quiet, but the views were nonexistent--a view of an alley. Service was good from everyone, although we could tell we were in Rome (and not Switzerland) by the fact that the fitness center opened more than 1 hour late one day (with no explanation) and we had trouble finding a waitress in the empty restaurant one morning, even though the restaurant had opened an hour earlier (we ended up going to the front desk who found someone who could help us in the restaurant). Our biggest complaint was that the air conditioner in one of our rooms could not cool the room enough. It seemed to work fine in our 2nd room. While the hotel sent someone to look into the problem, we never seemed to be able to cool the room down enough. Since I like the room cool (mid 60's) while I sleep, I probably would not stay here again. The fitness center and spa was surprisingly good for a hotel in Rome. There was a beautiful Roman bath, two treadmills, a few bikes, a rower, and some weight equipment. There was also a beautiful relaxation room (inside the former bank vault). There were a number of great sidewalk restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, and even a Hard Rock Cafe 5 minutes from the hotel in case you crave a burger or a huge American salad. While sitting in the lobby, I overhead a member of the Boscolo family talking about their hotel chain and their desire to provide a 5-star experience in their properties. If it weren't for the HVAC problems, I would rate this as a 4+ (for our larger room) and a 4-star (for our smaller room). Service was good but not great, although it was nice to hear the Boscolo family member talking with a great deal of passion about their intention to offer great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaNancy
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate for Rome for this hotel and it was well worth it. It was the least expensive hotel we stayed at during our 18 day trip through France and Italy. The rooms are very modern and clean. I couldn't believe how nice it was for the price we paid. But along with that, there are no amenities. No breakfast buffets that are inclusive or snacks down in the reading room and internet was $20 EUR for 24 hours or .50 EUR per minute. We went upstairs to the terrace restaurant for a snack/light lunch and noted that the menu was very pricey. Everything would have cost at least $20 someodd EUR for even a salad. Needless to say, we walked around the corner and ate at one of the sidewalk cafes. The relaxation room downstairs was great, and they do have a small pool and spa with bubbles - not high powered jets. You can also read/relax upstairs on the roof terrace in the sun if you can take the heat. There's a bar upstairs as well. Word of caution, if you get a room on the 5th floor, you may get a room underneath the restaurant/bar. If you are a light sleeper or sleep before midnight, you may get woken up between the hours of 11-1 am by chairs scraping and footsteps above.

Reviews.Title: “Mafia style methods at the bar”
Reviews.Author: vimarn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully designed, the rooms are small but comfortable. Staff at reception is reasonalbly friendly. We stayed three nights last May, one evening (around 6 pm) one of us ordered a tea at the bar which consisted of a can of hot water and an ordinary tea bag. The cost was Euro 20!!!! When we complained the bar tender said, that's the way it is, a glass of champagne was also Euro 28!!!. We were asked to pay cash as apparently the machine was out of order and they were unable to charge it to our rooms. When we checked out we mentioned this to the cashier who was very helpful; she inquired and found out that a tea would normally cost Euro 8 and a glass of champagne would have been Euro 26 (still far too expensive), but she could not do anything as we had settled the bill already. According to the receptionist the bar is not run by the hotel itself. Upon return to our homes I sent an e-mail to boscolo's customer care and complained about this incident, but not surprisingly I have not received a reply. If just need a room and nothing else, it's ok, but if you want more, they treat you like a fool.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely design, but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne5
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews my expectations for this hotel were rather tempered, but it wasn't as bad as I expected. The prices were worse though! The design of the hotel was really fantastic, especially the lobby and public spaces. Leisure facilities were nice (for an urban hotel) but there were loads of tiles missing from the jacuzzi. I did still enjoy it though. I really liked the design of the room, but it was literally as small as it could possibly be. Six inches taken away from any of the walls would have made it impossible to move around. Very nice bathroom. Service was mixed: it was undeniably a little pretentious but there were many staff members were very nice to us. The real issue with this hotel is the price, it just isn't worth it. €10 for a cup of tea at the rooftop bar.....okay maybe it is a gourmet, organic, pieces-of-whole-dried-fruit cup of tea? No, it was €10 for a Twinings tea bag. €7 for a can of coke in the mini-bar. €30 for a room-service club sandwich. Yes, THIRTY EURO. The ridiculous prices go on and on and on. In short: I was left with a distinct feeling that the hotel knows it is beautiful and wants you to pay out the nose for the privilege of staying there. I did enjoy it but -- given the price -- I can't say I would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel desperate service.”
Reviews.Author: conaatatu
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from two nights in Hotel Aleph. We stayed on a package of two nights bed and breakfast and one dinner and use of the hotels leisure facilities. This package cost over €800.00. The hotel is a real hip hotel and a beautiful design, but the service is desperate. Also the bar and restaurant in the main hotel were closed for the duration of the stay, which meant there was no atmosphere. They have a beautiful rooftop bar and restaurant where we had dinner. However, the food was the worst I had ever eaten and the price of drink is crazy. It is €25 for a club sandwich and €10 for a coke. On our first night (room 509), the noise from a ventalation system was very annoying and when I rang reception I was told that it was due to their location and that people have different levels of tolerance. I asked could a manager come up ansd see what it was. I was told (Saturday night) that the manager was gone home and would not be back until Monday and that they could move romms for us tomorrow. We had luggage everywhere and decided to stay put for the sake of one night. Breakfast was also poo and the service was terrible. Staff with their hands in their pockets. The fruit on the buffet consisted of prunes and tinned pears. If you are interested in hotel design, call in to see it but I could not recommend this hotel and would not stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunny1_hb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is classed 5 star and it is very nice but the room was small at £125 per night (was meant to be £250 per night but I won 2 nights stay by auction on lastminute.com). The air-con didn't work as someone had "requested the vents to be taped up"and the hotel forgot to untape them! Breakfast was OK but not to order and quite mediocre for the price. The Spa was very nice and relaxing after all the walking in Rome during the day. Very central hotel but in a back street (as are most hotels in Rome) and easy to get to all major attractions by walking. Termini was only 10 minutes walk from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “4 days @ Aleph”
Reviews.Author: ugregra
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 days at this greatly positioned hotel. On a very quiet strada 1/2 block off of the Via Veneto. The staff was always helpful and courteous, taking the time to make suggestions on transportation, making restaurant suggestions and reservations and generally friendly and amicable. The room was different as expected, very clean and well appointed. The drinks at the bar were overpriced but in this location you are only a 1/2 block walk from many beatiful bars and restaurants offering great food and fare with fabulously placed tables to see the goings on up and down the Via Veneto. In walking distance you also have great shopping as well as the famous antiquity of the Eternal City. We almost did not stay at this hotel because of having trouble with the company taking care of there reservations. I reported this when at the hotel and they were very concerned. The Canadian outfit handling the reservations almost prevented my wife and I from having a great hotel experience, in a great location, in a great city!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, very desapointed”
Reviews.Author: Beril
Reviews.Content: We spend a 3-days weekend at Aleph and the overall experience was just desapointment. The front desk is arrogant and gives you the impression that you are there to pay. If you want to use internet you have to buy a 20 euros card and nobody explains you that you have to disactivate the account before you close the explorer, which means that the next time you want to connect, the card is already expired and you have to buy another one. Don't book a taxi by the hotel ; I unfortunatly did and once i was inside the cab I was surprised there was not the taxi meter on. The taxi driver then told me that the price was arranged with the hotel and obviously much more expensive that a regular drive. Breakfast is a disaster, we had to wait long time until a waiter comes to clean the table. And than we discovered that no choice of bread or fruit was available...When we asked a waitress to take an order she just asked 'A minute', which is not very polite. Rooms are small, bathrooms poorly furnished. I will not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Aleph Romance Stay”
Reviews.Author: MarkFrinton
Reviews.Content: Stayed with the wife on the romance package picked up from hotel by there limo - very nice, upgraded to room with private terrace room number 415 nice size, champagne strawberrys and chocolate in room also had a car for three hours so went on sight seeing trip Ostia port which was fantastic ! Also had a meal in hotel which was very good - down sides ? Well the decor is bit different downstairs either love or hate it. Resturant staff bit pretentious drinks and mini bar expensive, overall though very good may be different if we had a standard room, paid about £1000 for three nights which was fair for location service and room. The spa was shut when we were there so went to there sister hotel over the road spa small bit tatty not worth the money really.

Reviews.Title: “Crap Service”
Reviews.Author: Ian78
Reviews.Content: I planned a romantic weekend away for my fiance's birthday. Our first impressions were were pretty good but then the whole experience went rapidly downhill. They advertised this as a five star hotel however expect TWO star service. The facilities in the room are not anywhere near five star standard. The staff did not give customer service any thought and the bar tried charging ten euros for a bottle of water!! The website stated that there was a swimming pool available. We found this to be untrue. We certainly would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: Laurentina
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a quiet street near Via Veneto. On the outside, the hotel appears to be less than impressive. However, once you are inside, the lobby is very chic. After reading some of the previous reviews, I was skeptical about the staff and its service level. My husband and I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a bit on the small size by American standards. It reminded me of a cruise ship cabin. Everything was well appointed but I am not sure if it is worth the high rates. I will say the the location is great. The Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps were within a short walk. The Metro is also conveniently located at the end of the street. A word of caution; if you are planning to take a taxi from the hotel, you will be in for a wait.

Reviews.Title: “The Aleph”
Reviews.Author: NK135
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aleph last year as it came highly recommended by friends for it's location, being only a short walk from the Spanish Steps. When we arrived at the hotel it looked very impressive, Reception was very grand and the staff who checked us in were very efficient and polite. The rooms however were a bit of a let down mainly due to the size! They were very small and also they were very bog standard......from seeing the striking reception and bar I had thought the rooms might be a bit more exciting than they actually were. All in all it was a good hotel, but I'm not sure it offered fantastic value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: JDSX
Reviews.Content: It's not a terrible hotel but it's waaaay overpriced. It looks trendy in the pictures but when you get there it's just overdone. The decor was haphazard. What's worse is the place is completely dead. We were there for 3 nights and no one was ever at the bar. The location is not bad but not great. They have a small shallow pool available to the guests but it's in disrepair with tiles missing and the thing is so grimy I felt dirty coming out. You can find much better for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent..”
Reviews.Author: dylan1020
Reviews.Content: A great Hotel in a great location. Stayed for a weekend with my girlfriend and we had a great time. Having read some of the reviews i was a bit dubious but decided to chance it anyway as it looked good on the Website! The lobby is fantastic and the rooms are cool with a contempoary design. The beds are huge and the rooms have excellent bathrooms. However I would suggest spending a few extra pounds on a Superior or Deluxe room over a Classic in order to get better space. The staff were polite and very helpful and were able to answer all our questions with regards to Rome. The Rooftop Bar and Restaurant is very cool and a great place to enjoy an evening Cocktail or Nightcap. The only negative I found were the bar prices. 12 Euros for a beer is way too much in any language but i guess if you want to stay in 5* luxury then you have to pay 5* prices!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but very overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Hip-Hotels-Lover
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel is stunning without a doubt, so you're full of expectations by the time you get to your room. That's where the bubble bursts unfortunately ! The standard type bedroom that we had was fine for a weekend break. It wasn't massive but it was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The decor left a bit to be desired given the wow factor downstairs but it was neutral and there was a large black and white print along one wall. For a weekend break there were plenty of drawers and cupboard space. The bathroom is designed as a wet-room, so there is no bath but there's a large shower (just be careful not to soak the rest of the room!) There are plenty of fluffy towels and two bathrobes. The roof terrace is a great place to sit during the warm evenings, with candles and big comfy sofas, but I'd suggest that you went somewhere else first for more drinks as the prices are truly extortionate. 28 Euros for a glass of champagne is way over the top. The barman was also a bit annoying as he insisted on talking to us, when we really wanted to just chat to each other and enjoy every last drop of the drinks that we'd ordered. The location was ok - about 15 minutes from the Spanish steps, and the hotel is in a quiet side street so there's virtually no noise at night. My major gripe about this hotel is the price. You're led to believe that this is a luxury boutique hotel, but in all honesty they've spent so much money on the lobby that they seem to have run out of ideas in the rest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomasclo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Aleph for three nights in September with my wife. We had previously stayed in Exedra when our kids had accompanied us on our last trip but wanted something different when on our own. Some of the negative reviews posted on this site almost made me cancel the reservation, but decied to brave it. Booked a deluxe room with its own private terrace, staff were fantastic from start to finish, great breakfast served on our terrace each morning, great pre dinner cocktails at the roof bar every night, super location....... still at a total loss on some previous reviews. Style with substance, expensive but worth it.....

Reviews.Title: “Definetly not value for money”
Reviews.Author: HPP
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here in August for one night having not been able to get into the hotel of our choice. We were looking for something luxurious, a bit different and value for money. The website seemed to suggest this was the case.The play on 'design' is a bit far fetched as it only applies to the entrance. The room was not bad but bedside lights and air con didn't work and we would have expected at least some complimentary water at least at this price. Prices in the mini bar and room service border on the offensive! When we checked out they wanted to charge us 40 euros more than the agreed price at booking. Reception staff very rude almost to the point of accusing us of being liars and did not relent. Not interested in the lights or air con not working. I'm not surprised it was empty. They have lost our custom next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced..not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: katiosha
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through expedia. We had asked for a King size bed but we got a small room with a queen size bed instead. Breakfast was extra, which came as a total surprise considering most hotels in Italy include breakfast. The room service and restaurant was extremely overpriced..for example tea (for one) was 10 Euros, Coke 12 Euros...a club sandwitch 25Euros! The hotel location was good, very central. Basically that was the only good thing about the hotel. The decor of the main lobby and the rooftop patio were very modern, art deco, except we never saw anyone eating at the restaurant or rooftop patio..probably too expensive to eat there! On their website, they advertise an indoor pool in their spa...it was more like a jaccuzzi...small one too. For the amount of money they were charging, one could find a much better hotel in that same area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Uneven”
Reviews.Author: pamsrollz
Reviews.Content: Instantly, we were put off by all of the red decor and the loud music as we entered the tiny lobby. Our room was comfortable, very quiet and clean. We tried to use the internet service in our room that was included, but no one was ever able to switch it on during our 5 night stay. We felt more uncomfortable day by day, in that this place was designed to attract a younger, bar hopping crowd (we are in our 50s). Even the bar was so small, it was difficult to enjoy a drink - but if you were lucky enough to sit, a lovely tray of complimentary antipasti was served. The inexperienced staff was just not able to deal with any mishaps, but tried to be helpful. The breakfast buffet was boring and bland - poor food choices, unripe fruit and exactly same every day. The one dinner we had at the hotel was delicious, professionally served, and it was quite a lovely menu - that was a bright surprise. The location is good, but given the number of well located hotels in Rome, I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our advice is to avoid this hotel :-(”
Reviews.Author: Tony14
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel Aleph for five nights and we were extremely disappointed. Our advice is to avoid this hotel. Overall the hotel was much below our expectations both in terms of service, design and comfort. We have been to many 5 stars hotels over the past few years and this one is definitely below average. The hotel has a stunning lobby (which probably explained the design award), but the rest of the hotel is not as design as one could expect. The service is uneven: some people were very friendly; other unhelpful and aggressive. We booked a deluxe room and what was our surprise when we were showed our first room: on the second floor with almost no natural light; overseeing a small unattractive backyard. In the room the ceiling lamp was broken so you could see all the bulbs. Another lamp on the wall had been badly repaired. The bathroom was more like the one you would find in a hospital; not in a design hotel. On top of this we had twin beds while we had asked for a single bed. After we complained, we were shown a number of other rooms that were not really better. After dealing with unfriendly or unmotivated front desk staff we finally complained directly to the Boscolo reservation centre and we were then proposed to get one of the few rooms with a very large terrace (roughly 40 sqm) at the same conditions as our original booking. Our last room was definitely better than the first one but overall our experience in the hotel was not very good: some of the staff was taking drinks from our minibar during our absence; leaving empty bottles in the room. The restaurant was really overpriced and a lot of prices were not properly listed, so you were getting different prices from different people at different point of time…

Reviews.Title: “Average Aleph”
Reviews.Author: letar
Reviews.Content: I booked a 4 night stay at the Aleph Hotel through Expedia, despite having read the reviews on Trip Advisor. I decided to upgrade to a 'Superior Room' for an extra fee, in the hope that we would have a larger room as the Boscolo website described. On arrival, we were shown to a small room largely taken up by a huge bed. Single window faced onto central paved area so couldn't have curtains open at all as other windows on same level looked into our room. The bathroom was tiny and only had a shower, not the jacuzzi bath I assumed a superior room in a '5 star hotel' would include. On phoning reception, they offered to show us a deluxe suite with a bath (for an extra 200 euros a night! No thank you!). Shower had good pressure and temperature. But I did want a bath. Room was 'turned down' on 2 out of 4 nights, I use the term loosely as all they appeared to have done was replace the bath towels. Carpet remained unvacuumed the whole stay, once we came back after housekeeping had been, to find our TV remote missing. Bellboy arrived promptly with another though. Not that there was much to watch, as the only English channels were CNN and Bloomberg. Didn't eat in hotel, or use minibar as prices were extortionate. The gym is well-equipped but gym/spa were closed on one day of our stay for maintenance. We also didn't have a safe in our room but one was put in for us after we asked about this. I wouldn't really advise anyone to stay here, hotel bar was totally empty of people on every single of our nights and if you do book, MAKE SURE you get the room size you paid for as I'm sure ours was not a superior (despite the reception staff insisting it was).

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: FLAvour
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this hotel to have a romantic week together: we are both Italians, we live in Rome, we didn't need somewhere to stay, we just wanted to relax ourselves, so we choosed this hotel, that seemed the best, as I like luxury and modern locations. We booked the best room, and it was really wonderful: it has even a hot jacuzzi on the private terrace! But there was just one BIG problem: we talked by phone with the reception girl, telling her that we wanted to stay there for seven nights with a full board treatment, but we had no money available on our credit card (we pay cash), and the girl told us that this was ok. We arrived, everything ok, we had a wonderful dinner, then we returned to our room. 8 in the morning, we were sleeping, than the phone rang: there was the concierge, very disappointed with us because in the night (!) he checked our credit card and we had no money available. What news! But my boyfriend had to go immediately downstairs to explain the situation, and as you imagine this is not pleasant when you pay 1700€ per night, they made us feel like we couldn't afford it !!!! The concierge has been very rude with him, telling that if we wanted to stay there for the entire week we had to pay the total rate in that moment...of course this was possible for us, but I think this is not a correct behaviour in a 5+ star hotel: the concierge had all our documents, what could we do, run out without paying??? Then we picked our car from their garage and noticed that a lot of things had been stolen, amoung them a pair of Gucci shoes....they didn't apologise in any way,they gave us no explanations, they were just thinking at money... so we payd that night and returned home, maybe less luxurious but surely more relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Great interior, freezing in the bar!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a surprise treat for my boyfriend's birthday. Was a little apprehensive after reading so many mixed reviews on this site but couldn't seem to find any other modern, funky hotels in Rome so booked it anyway. Was glad to find that the negatives described in most of the reviews were not true. Yes, it is expensive and yes, the bar is extortionate but the rooms are not tiny and the staff were very friendly. We did not have dinner or breakfast so can't comment on that but the free canapes in the bar were delicious and let's just say the bar staff aren't shy with the alchohol in the cocktails!! Great location for walking to many of the main attractions as well as being close to some great neighbourhood restaurants. Pity the library did not have real books. The bar area was also freezing - would have been the perfect setting for a big open fire but all we got was full-on air conditioning in November!! All in all, probably not the best value for money ever but as a treat, it was worth it for the novely factor and location.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Rane
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the top floor "Executive suite". It was suprisingly small junior suite (only one room). It has a huge terrace but another room has a free access to that terrace too! Certainly not worth of the rack rate 3000e. I paid 1430e. Even with that price it is much less value than terrace suite at DeRussie. The room was beautiful as well as the whole hotel. Very contemporary design but not minimalist, lot of dark colours. Very frienly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: ResortTravellers
Reviews.Content: I have travelled extensively and stayed at many 5* plus hotels. I would find it extremely hard to class the Aleph as anything but a 4 Star at best. As with nearly all the other reviews my wife and I had similar issues. Some staff were friendly whilst others just were plain rude. The rooms were extremely nice esp the bathrooms but the cost was way over the top. One day we ordered a sandwich in the bar which took 40mins to arrive and was only 2 slices of bread with cheese in the middle (no salad or sides) and it cost £28!!! We were also charged on our final bill £30 for paying with our Mastercard. We ordered a private taxi from the hotel to take us to the airport. We paid for it on the bill but the taxi driver still demanded a further 30euros for being stuck in traffic - I complained to the hotel on my return and they still have not refunded me the money. The hotel is very clean and is very upmarket but there are several other hotels in Rome with equal quality at half the price. Rome was a fantastic city but this hotel truly marred the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Foxxy and Intimate”
Reviews.Author: Moomin79
Reviews.Content: The Aleph is a sanctuary from the hectic pace in this beautiful city. We checked in early and were allocated a great room except it had no bath (just an enormous walk-in shower). I called the reception who moved us down the corridor to a slightly bigger room with a fantastic bathroom. There was a sunken jacuzzi bath and more blue glass than you can shake a stick at. Bed was so comfortable and fresh sheets were used everyday. The housekeeper checked every afternoon that our room was satisfactory and asked if we needed anything. ( I read a review in which someone mentioned that the staff were rude - I disagree! They were a friendly bunch of young italians and nothing was too much trouble). The hotel benefits from being off a main street so a quiet night is guaranteed. Thick roman blinds mean that the room is dark - perfect when recovering from too much vino. Spa was a welcome retreat to rest tired legs. Again, more blue glass and soothing lighting. There is no swimming pool but large thermal baths and 'bubble corridor' with water jets to relax in. Sauna and steamroom and a great mini gym if you like that sort of thing! Also a chill out zone in the room that was used as the bank safe in days gone by. Didn't eat in the hotel - concierge gave us some great restaurant ideas (acqui negra is a funky and lively restaurant worth a look). We had two drinks that came to 30 Euros so gave the bar a miss for the following nights. Mini bar is also frighteningly expensive...best to avoid. Aleph is something different and something more interesting than the average 5*hotel. If you want chintz and old world charm then stay somewhere else. This place is modern and not afraid to stand out. Check it out, I would rate it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Style over Substance , but great staff”
Reviews.Author: bspoll
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night at the Aleph at end of Jan. We were on honeymoon and they upgraded us to a deluxe on arrival. The hotel lobby is beautiful to look at , but the hotel is let down by the little things e.g. prices are horrendous in the bar , the spa was smelly ( drains ) , pool was freezing cold and the sauna wasn't even warm on the plus side , the location is great , just off Piazza Berberini , the staff are very very helpful and it is soooo stylish but we moved out after one night and went to the Russie

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome for business, stayed in this fantastic hotel. I would highly recommend anyone to check this hotel out. It's superbly chic, clean, class and members of their staff just can't seem to do enough for us. The bedroom was brilliant and the bathroom was extremely modern. The square glass sink was most attractive. If you're staying in this hotel, you must grab the chance to dine in the restaurant. Not only is the food outstanding good, the service was impeccable. This hotel is top-class!

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the Worst Customer treatment ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In september 2005, we had a film crew traveling throughout Europe for months. Due to the busy season we had to stay at the Aleph Hotel in Rome, since our first choice hotel was booked. I know that film crews can be obnoxious at times, but I swear we were well behaved and quiet. Mind you we paid $50,000+ in hotel rooms and incidental for less than a week to stay at the Aleph with a whole film crew. Some of the rooms are VERY small even though they are classified as “deluxe”. The Suite are a bit comparable to a true Deluxe room at a Four Seasons or Ritz. However, the service is the worst I have ever encounter. Normally, we compensate the staff quite well due to the impact we have on a hotel. However, the Aleph was disgustingly rude. While we were there, the plumbing broke and there was the smell of fecal matter throughout the hotel. When new guests would arrive a strange look would overcome them and you could overhear their attempt to figure out the origin of this stench. This problem lasted the ENTIRE week we were there. The power went out in one of our production coordinators rooms and the hotel didn’t offer to help him move all of his kits and luggage in the dark. The staff was completely unapologetic to the smell and over ½ of the crew was bitten by mosquitoes (which is disgusting amidst a sewage problem). Meanwhile, the director had her 2 year son in a room that was completely ruined with sewage smell. We received absolutely now compensation, not even a verbal apology. The staff literally snuffed their noses at us and ignored anyone who complained (even non-film crew guests). The wireless internet would not work in the conference room which was literally right next to the lobby (where it worked), unless we paid an outrageous fee of $20 hour. Please. Also, the rooftop restaurant would have been nice, except they decided to close early sporadically throughout the week. The only other option was room service, such as a club sandwich (no sides, no fries, nada) for $40 US. Ridiculous. I would NEVER stay here again. It’s one thing when a hotel has some issues out of their control, but when they have no remorse, compensation or even a “sorry”, it is completely unacceptable. They turned their noses up at us and even laughed. I hope they go out of business. Do yourself a favor and stay at a hostel over this pile of junk!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Suprising little gem”
Reviews.Author: Riyah
Reviews.Content: The Aleph's location is great. Its a 5 min walk to the Spanish Steps and about 10 to Via Corso. Actually, everything in central Rome is within a 20 min walk anyway. The hotel is boutique style with a modern luxurious feel. The decor is fantastic. I got a corner room (#510)and found the size comperable to any hotel in a European city. The lounge is very nice and relaxing. Reception staff (especially Nicoletta) are very helpful and are always ready to step in when the concierge is not available for info and reservations. The rooftop terrace was closed our etire trip-a disappointment. However ran into a nasty patch when they asked us to leave a day early due to overbooking. Also , roomservice is ALWAYS forgetful...need I say more? Overall a very nice stay in a very nice hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in August”
Reviews.Author: StAntonJulie
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because I prefer trendy hotels with style rather than bland with space. I note from reading other reviews, that there is a tendency to judge on quantity as opposed to quality. I visited this hotel with a girlfriend and booked a twin room, however, on arrival there were none left so we were given a double each. Fantastic - especially as we only paid cGBP60/night between us. The terrace bar is v. expensive - however it is also v. exclusive and on a hotel August evening was amazing. The only complaint I had was that we were there during the mid-summer bank holiday - an exodus from Rome by locals - so the there was a skeleton staff and the pool was closed. Oh yes, and we booked a cab through the hotel to Rome Cimpiano and the cabbie took us to Da Vinci. I ended up having a frightening row with the driver (whose cab had already broken down during the journey). I don't know whose fault it was, but when I called the hotel during the journey for assistance they weren't terribly interested - probably because we had already left and we were to meet the cost of the taxi.......I ended up in the police station at the airport following an assault on me by the driver.

Reviews.Title: “Boscolo Aleph, what a deception...”
Reviews.Author: Haaster
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Boscolo Aleph hotel at the end of October 2005. Paid 635 Euro for two nights in a double room, so I was expecting pure luxury based on this pricing. The reception looks cool, the location close to the Spanish Steps is cool, BUT: The room was sooooooooooo small that it was one big deception. My suggestion is that if you are looking for a nice reception and location, go to the Aleph. But if you are looking for good value for your money, SKIP the Aleph and hopefully you will find a hotel room where you can actually walk. My hotelroom in Aleph was just too small!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a three week tour of Europe staying at 4-5 star hotels along the way I have to say that the Boscolo Aleph was the absolute worse! The rooms were so small it was almost hard to move around. I will agree that the rooms in Europe are smaller than those in the state, but this was a closet that was passed off as a DELUXE room. One of the reasons that we thoght this would be a good hotel as it claimed to be "high" design hotel. It had some design flair but no real substance. The service was also lacking. It seems that the company mantra was to be aloof and rude. It is a shame since we had such wonderful experiences at our other hotels throughout Italy and this somewhat soured my experience in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Don"t Trust the Aleph!”
Reviews.Author: heels
Reviews.Content: We made reservations over two months prior to arrival.We also recieved a conformation letter. They did not have us booked! To add insult to injury they were unsympathetic. After three hours of waiting for a room that was less accomadating than the room we originally reserved. The next morning we recieved our bill with an extra night charge. We tried to resolve the bill with Francesca the manager and she provided no help. When we arrived home from our trip we recieved a bill in the mail fom the Aleph with more charges than when we left. these charges were over $500. I would be careful with booking with this hotel they could lose your reservation and i wouldnt trust them with your credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ruggiero
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aleph for three nights, if you like particular design, this is the place to stay! Its a really nice hotel, beautiful entrance and restaurant, all red and black, very nice decorated, we liked it so much and would definitely return here! The staff is very friendly and helpful, the location very good.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTMENT!”
Reviews.Author: L0VeVaCaTiOnS
Reviews.Content: If you're expecting to waste all of your money at the hotel, stay at the aleph. I have no complaints about the decor and the staff. The hidden costs blew us away. They don't tell you that the parking is 35 euros a day, the breakfast (that included butter, rolls, left over corn and slices of pie and cereal) is 22 euros. At the bar upstairs, two shots are 50 euros. Also, don't forget your nose plugs because the hallways stink of sewage. We had to hold our breaths and run to the elevator it was so bad!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three-night stay at this hotel. After reading the reviews on this site, I feel like we stayed at an entirely different hotel. The staff was great! When we first arrived, they actually took us up to our room, and gave us a short tour of the hotel so we could get our bearings. Throughout our entire stay, they were very helpful and courteous. We loved the rooftop bar. Although a little on the expensive side, the atmosphere and the views were well worth the price of the drinks. And let's talk about location. This hotel is well-situated, in the middle of everything. We were able to walk most places, usually taking a short cab-ride to the furthest place, and working our way back on foot. We were within a couple of blocks of the Spanish Steps, and felt very safe walking there, even in the middle of the night. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Thank you, Aleph, for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have just returned from a long weekend to Rome, staying at the Boscolo Aleph Hotel. We did arrive before the 2pm checkin and our room wasn't ready. The hotel were happy to look after our bags and throughout our stay found all the staff helpful and pleasant. The hotel is small, but nice. Not necessarily worth the money it cost us for 3 nights, approx £500, and that didn't include breakfast. The rooms are small but clean and nicely decorated. Excellent housekeeping service and a safe is provided free in your room, i suggest you use it just to be secure. My husband used the Spa, the pool is very shallow and not really for swimming, it really is just to float and relax. they offer many treatments but they are expensive. There is a lovely Rooftop terrace which opens at 6pm every evening (provided the weather is fine). The view from the terrace is amazing and its a lovely place to relax and have a drink before dinner. WARNING the drinks are VERY expensive, my bacardi and coke was 15 euros and husbands beer was 12 euros. You do get as much free canapes as you want with your drink, but still........ Location wise the hotel is ideal for walking to all the tourist sights except the Vatican. The hotel will order you a cab and it cost us 10euros. the street behind the hotel called the Via Vineto is where all the nice bars and restaurants are and its worth taking a walk up to the Villa Borgese Gardens. Via del Corso is a short walk from the hotel with the Colloseum and Trevi Fountain near. We had an amazing time in Rome and the hotel was nice, but i don't think we would stay there again. There are bigger hotels in the same area with more facilities, which probably cost less.

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic”
Reviews.Author: nightengale
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for the first three nights of our honeymoon at the end of August 2005. We decided on this hotel due to its modern look. We arrived late afternoon on a Sunday and could not have been more pleased by the appearance of the hotel. It was very romantic. Our room was quite large - I think that the honeymoon package included a deluxe room. The food was lovely in the restaurant and the champagne cocktails very nice. The staff were very attentive and friendly. We liked the location of the hotel. It is about a seven minute walk to the Spanish steps and main shopping area. We walked to the attractions a little further away too such as the colleseum (about 35 mins) as there is so much to see on the way and lots of cafes to stop off in. The downstairs spa was very relaxing and we actually had the facilities to ourselves each time we went as the hotel was so quiet. We were very pleased with our choice of hotel and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Promised much but was actually average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May 2005, having been somewhat swayed by the pictures on the hotel's website. Although the public areas were very stylish, the bedrooms were somewhat small, with only a shower, no bath. The hotel restaurant was also expensive - 60 euros for a main course was not uncommon. Location wise pretty good - 5 minute walk from the Via Veneto, 15 minutes to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain too. What promised much actually turned out to be quite average.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had read the bad reviews here on trip advisor and was extremely concerned about staying the Aleph hotel. I even wrote to the hotel voicing my concerns. This was an extremely special holiday for my mother who has been fighting breast cancer. I cannot fault the staff or the hotel on anything. They were brilliant. On the first night we received a huge fruit salad to welcome us, and chocolates there after. The staff were extremely kind and knowledgable. The concierge(s) were the best, they knew everything and they helped with everything. Similarly the reception staff were excellent. Full marks to them.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: WandH
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel a really nice treat. It was expensive but for a special occasion the hotel is extremley relaxing and confortable. We had a standard room and although small it was great for a chilled afternoon snooze after walking round romes sites. Gym and Spa are very well presented if you fancy using them. The hotel Bar is extremley modern, looks very cool! However as others have mentioned about a tenner for a beer, but we only had the odd one drink on a couple of the nights. Overall extermley pleased with this hotel both my self and fiance (she said yes at the top of the spanish steps during our stay) found this hotel perfect for a speacial occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the Aleph.”
Reviews.Author: krakenchops
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in January and watched average/bad reviews pile up about this hotel. Thankfully the hotel was nothing like the bad reviews, and I encountered none of the bad points mentioned. For all of those complaining that the roof terrace was closed, try reading the website. It states it is only open from June…duhhhhh We arrived at 11am to check in to our deluxe room for 4 days, which was ready which was a nice surprise. I had also arranged a 2pm check out which was all arranged. The room on the 2nd floor was appointed exactly as per the website. The only thing missing was the bath robes, which were brought up within 5 minutes of me asking. All of the fittings worked and were in excellent condition. The bed was much bigger than my king-size bed at home…it was huge!!!! Bathroom had a powerful shower and nice large bath. The room/bathroom was kept spotlessly clean by the maid. All of the staff I encountered at this hotel always had a smile and were really helpful. I honestly can’t understand how anyone could have a problem with them. I would say that yes this hotel is expensive for sundries. A coke from the minbar costs 5 euros and a beer on the roof terrace costs 12 euros. Let’s face it you don’t have to buy them, and there a plenty of shops around this hotel to stock up, the via Veneto is about 1 minute walk. The hard rock café is also about 1 minute away if you must have American/English fare. Barberini tube is 30 seconds away which gives access to all of the main sites although they are all perfectly walkable from the hotel. The furthest being the colliseum which is about a 30 minute walk. Don’t believe any of the bad reviews the Aleph is absolutely superb.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting stay at the Aleph”
Reviews.Author: ellebud
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Boscolo Aleph from June 3rd to the 10th. Good news: Well located. We walked all over Rome. The staff recommended the restaurant down the street...Court de something...it was excellent. We arrived early in the morning after travelling for 18 hours and they offered us an early check in at no extra charge...wonderful. Bad news: With the early check in we got a standard room. It is TINY. The bathroom is very modern. Think the Expedia commercial with the older parents and the Dick Van Dyke them...gorgeous and very modern. Horrible lighting for make up. The linens were weirdly scratchy. Very expensive food. We never ate at the hotel. The decor is very trendy. We prefer a more elegant hotel but to each his or her own. I would definitely stay in the same area again (the Via Veneto), but would probably choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the recent reviews, I feel like I have to write in to defend the Aleph. My husband and I stayed there for three days in March for our first anniversary. I had done quite a bit of research and had narrowed down my choices to the Aleph and the Capo d'Africa. We were staying at Le Sirenuse in Positano directly after, so I wanted to find a very nice, but not extravagant hotel for Rome. I was very happy with Aleph and especially after visiting Rome, very happy we didn't choose the Capo d'Africa as it was quite out of the way being down by the Colesseum. I liked the decor, but I like eclectic places. And I found the service to be nice.....I wouldn't say they went completely out of their way. But, they were very friendly and did exactly what I asked. I corresponded with the concierge several times before arriving to set up dinner reservations and all was done as I asked. I was very excited with our room. I will say that I not only called the 800 Boscolo number to book, but also followed up with several e-mails to both the concierge and front desk to tell them it was an anniversary visit and very special. We paid for a regular room but received a room on the top floor with its own terrace. Plus, they gave us a bottle of complementary wine. All of this I found very fitting for their rating. I believe that it did have something to do with the fact that I had requested an outdoor area when making the reservation and did follow up several times. I did not use the spa, but I did go down to visit it - I did not find them to be snotty as other reviewers have. Also, I was aware the roof top terrace was closed during our stay because it was still spring. So, I was not surprised by that. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised. I do think we received one of their nicer rooms and that may have had everything to do with my impression. But, I did enjoy my stay and would recommend this hotel to a friend. I will say that if you do have the means though, my husband and I stopped into the Hotel de Russie during one of our days and that hotel blew me away. Of course, the prices were double what I paid at the Aleph and is another star higher. The Aleph exceeded the expectations that I had.

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from staying at the aleph for 5 nights, the hotel was disappointing, in one word "superficial". This is perfectly illustrated by the fact that the books in the library are not real, they are holograms!!!! very trendy I am sure but not much use if you want to read a book. Papers were only Italian, and the internet is not free of use, to connect your laptop in your own room costs 50 cents per minute of internet time. TV is very limited in English, only Bloomberg, CNN and Italian MTV (amusing to watch the Osbourn's dubbed in Italian!!!!) Not that you go to Rome to watch the box, but quite nice to have the choice after a long day walking around. They said the BBC was not yet available even though it is listed in the hotel brochure. There were about 4 english speaking movies to choose from the in-house TV menue at a cost of 14 euros for the first choice and 7 thereafter. The roof terrace was closed, a big pity as it was the main reason for choosing the hotel. Funny that they have an area of the web site for "news" and don't list it. Maybe they should title it as "good news only" The spa was a bit of a joke really, the water in the pool area which is designed to relax in, not swim in, was the temperature suitable for swimming in, not relaxing in. It was VERY COLD (in my view). The sauna and steam room were OK. The location of the hotel was OK. I think we would stay near piazza Navona next time, this is a perfect location access to many other areas on foot. Staff were good, very polite and attentive when asked for something. Like the other review, I asked for an iron, but was told I could not have one. Maybe European law because I have been refused before in hotels. Or maybe it is just another way of making more money out of you as they of course have a laundry service. The mini bar provided the suspicion that is was designed to maximise short term profitability, as it was one of those fridges that was sensitive to any movement within, so that if you removed a bottle of water it was automatically charged to the bill. We managed to squeeze a couple of small bottles in. It may sound tight, but about 4 euros for a small bottle of water or can of coke is just a rip off. These small things made one feel as thought the hotel is really best suited for business travellers, who expense every thing. Actually there was constant Bloomberg TV in the lift. As an investment manager it was a bit unrelaxing to use the lift, as being on holiday you don't really want to know what the NASDAQ is doing! We love Rome, this was our second visit within the year, but we will be searching for a different hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
