Reviews.Content: I just got back from a vacation in Europe and stayed at nothing but 5 or 4 1/2 star hotels. Aleph was by far the worse. The staff was not friendly or helpful. The concierge was rude. I've been to Rome 3 times in the last 3 years and I have a favorite restaurant that I like to go to. I told the concierge to make a resevation for me. She told me the restaurant no longer existed. Well, I decided to go anyway to Piazza Navona and lo and behold there it was and it was open and busy. It went down hill from there. Some of my jeans were stolen from my room. After complaining to management they had me go on a wild goose chase to report it to the Italian police. After the theft of clothes, I put a DO NOT DISTRUB sign on our door. Housekeeping went into my room anyways. I complained to management and he did nothing. This hotel ruined my time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, over priced under delivered”
Reviews.Author: posterguru
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We found very much the same problems listed so many times over. Uninspired staff, they will go out of there way to do nothing for you. The SPA is a rip off, we made 5pm reservations with the hotel directly, they included all services included with a "relaxing massage". We showed up promtly at 5pm, the massage was great, but directly after the massage we went in the steam room and were told promply to leave because they were closed and we were not allowed to use the facilities. EVERYONE else who recieved a massage that day was able to get a steam, whirlpool and relax. The spa said it was the hotels fault for not informing me that we would be able to complete the "relaxing massage" package, the Hotel of course blamed the spa, either way my credit card saw the entire charge. Rooms are very small and lacking many ammenities that would constitute a 4 star hotel. Tiny showers, tiny room, cheap bed and bedding. Highly over priced restaurant. Rip off mini bar. The hotel also tried to charge me more than my booked price, after an hour discussion, calling my travel agent, and faxing, we determined that someone at the hotel booked the wrong price, no credit yet to my card. No excusses, they put it in writing! At best this is a three star, over priced in every aspect. Even for Rome! We stay a boutique hotel all accross the world, and can honestly say this hotel dosen't live up to the Hype, avoid avoid, avoid. The room was clean, bathroom was fairly clean, sheets not changed daily.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: alainef
Reviews.Content: There are great things about this hotel: 1) Location - you can walk to the Trevi fountain (5-10 mins), the Spanish Steps (15 mins), Borghese Gardens (15 - 20 mins) and we even walked to the Coliseum (about 40 minutes) 2) Staff - we found them to be wonderful, very friendly and attentive. We especially loved the concierge, Silvia 3) Nicely appointed rooms - spotlessly clean The "good" things about this hotel are: 1) The red/black theme - although after a few days, this gets old as it is rather dark And the "not so good" things would be: 1) Shoe-box size rooms - even those with a king bed are small 2) The rooftop terrace (looks lovely) was closed during our stay All in all, this hotel met expectations....

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: jfssurrey
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at the Aleph as a birthday surprise for my girlfriend. Having stayed at a number of other boutique European hotels, I was most disappointed to find that, in our opinion, the Aleph did not make the grade. Although very clean and comfortable, we found the staff snobby and pompous and no effort was made to make us feel special. We booked to stay for 2 nights in a deluxe room. The first room we were offered was no way near the spec of the room as featured on the hotel website. I asked to see another room and that turned out to be 'better'. Breakfast was also very disappointing. When you have paid over £500 for a 2 night stay, the additional charge of 40 euros for a 'very' limited continental breakfast was most unwelcome. We were then sat so close to another couple that we might as well have been sharing a table for four!! We cannot comment on the hotel roof terrace as for the entirety of our stay, it was closed for maintenance!! Lastly, on departure, we asked the concierge to book us a taxi to the airport, she refused. She was only willing to offer the hotel limousine at 77 euros!! No thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Simply disappointing. The decor was the only nice feature of this hotel, everything else could be a lot better. The staff from top to bottom (receptionist, concierge, doorman) was very unfriendly and very unhelpful. The location could be a lot better. For the price you pay for this hotel you can get much much better. In summary, over-priced, poor-service hotel. Try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 10 days while at work in Rome. Brought my Spouse & child with me. Hotel staff was polite & very friendly. The doormen (Luca) were great for city & neighborhood info. Room was small but did not spend much time in it. Do not stop for a drink at the bar;beer = 12 euro & glass of wine is 15 euro. ouch!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rome Experience”
Reviews.Author: pnagrows
Reviews.Content: I said experience in the title, because staying in this hotel is an experience. From the black granite lobby floors to the cool decor and wonderful location, this hotel is the epitome of shic. Definitely not traditional, so dont expect the Holiday Inn. It was one of the most fun, and best hotels I've stayed in in Europe, and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have lived in Italy for two years now and the Aleph is by far the nicest hotel we have stayed at. The deluxe room we stayed in was both good sized and very modern with a small balcony overlooking the main street and the staff could not have been more helpful. I agree with some other reviews regarding the prices of the food and drinks in the hotel (very expensive) but there is a pizzeria accross the street and the Hard Rock Cafe is one block behind the hotel. Both the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps are within a 10 minute walk, with the Colosseum about 25 minutes. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Hip”
Reviews.Author: sueveed
Reviews.Content: The lobby/sitting rooms/restaurants are decorated in a surreal red and black heaven and hell theme. The rooms are very stylishing decorated but in much more relaxing tones of blue and light wood. Just keep in mind when making a reservation that the standard rooms are very, very small. A tight fit for two adults with luggage. The delux rooms are quite a bit larger and very comfortable. The hotel is in a great location near the Via Veneto but off a side street so it is very quiet and feels more exclusive. The only down side I found was the staff...they tend to "match" the hip decor and are not always as knowledgable and service-oriented as you would find in a 4 or 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could be alot better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Some bits were great, nice room, good location etc. But not what I would expect from a top hotel, spa was closed constantly over new year and when it was on, everything was cold, as they had been cleaning it and only turned sauna and pool heaters on as they opened it up. Must be better places for the money.

HotelInfo.Name: Boscolo Aleph
HotelInfo.Address: Via di San Basilio 15, 00185 Rome, Italy
